title: Healthcare IT Software Architect
description:
**100% REMOTE - US Citizenship Required**

Varada Consulting, LLC is looking for a full-time Healthcare IT Software Architect to support our Veterans Affairs client and work with cutting edge healthcare technology. This large-scale, $22.3 billion-dollar innovative healthcare IT program’s mission is to provide IT infrastructure modernizations and systems delivery support to the Veteran’s Affairs. This exciting program addresses some of the VA’s top priorities, including improving the efficiency of both claims processing and Veteran’s overall experiences when communicating within the organization.

Minimum qualifications:

* 5+ years of professional work experience
* Ability to work independently to design and develop new software products or major enhancements to existing software for a healthcare/clinical environment
* Act as highest-level technical expert, addressing problems of systems integration, compatibility, healthcare semantics, informatics and multiple platforms
* Demonstrated responsibility for project completion
* Perform feasibility analysis on potential future projects to management
* Bachelor's degree in Healthcare IT, computer science, electronics engineering, engineering or technical related field, or 10 years of additional relevant experience may be substituted in lieu of degree
* US Citizenship and the ability to obtain and maintain a Public Trust Clearance

Preferred qualifications:

* VA experience preferred
* Experience implementing Electronic Health Records

Join an Award –Winning Team! Voted as Most Innovative and Fastest Growing Company, Varada Consulting offers highly customized IT capabilities in the federal civilian and DoD market space in support of the mission objectives of the federal government. Varada provides competitive compensation and benefits packages including 100% employer paid healthcare premium, matching 401k, and unlimited education/training.

Varada Consulting, LLC is an Equal Employment Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $140,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* This position is supporting the Department of Veterans Affairs and requires US Citizenship, do you meet this requirement?

Experience:

* EHR systems: 1 year (Preferred)
* Software development: 3 years (Required)
* Healthcare IT: 4 years (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Kinaxis Solution Architect
description:
**Role: Kinaxis Solution Architect**

**Location: Remote**

**Duration: 12 months + Extension**

Job Summary:  
We are looking for a Kinaxis Rapid Response (RR) solution architect who can champion the design & delivery of the advanced solution capabilities. This is a high impact, individual contributor role having a high visibility within the business & IT stakeholders. The individual will be the key driver of the RR implementation, rollouts, continuous improvements, and applications support. The individual needs to be self-motivated, having hands-on experience in advanced RR capabilities, willing to take on complex requirements and develop solutions. The role requires excellent verbal & written communication skills and ability to build relationships at all levels of the business & IT organizations.

**Responsibilities:**

* A hands-on role, architect the complete the end-to-end supply chain planning solution using the Kinaxis RR platform.
* Develop long term enterprise strategy for the roll-out of the Kinaxis RR platform.
* Delivery proof of concept ideas/projects to improve / deploy functionalities.
* Establish industry best & standard RR processes.
* Hands on experience in guiding the solution configuration, troubleshooting technical/functional issues during the implementation.
* Implement continuous process improvements after the implementation.
* Design and deploy latest technology like advanced analytics, AI, machine learning to advance our Supply Chain and solve complex challenges (e.g., inventory optimization, S&OP simplification, others)
* Identity and implement continuous process improvements

**Skills & Experience**

* 10+ years of experience in Supply Chain Planning Solutions such as Demand Planning, Supply Planning, S&OP, and the like, with 4+ years of experience in Kinaxis Rapid Response
* Strong functional and RR analytics knowledge in Demand Planning, Supply & Production Planning, Inventory optimization, Constrained Planning, Sales, and Operations Planning (S&OP).
* Solution Architect! for at least two complete Kinaxis RR implementation projects.
* Possess good understanding of Kinaxis Rapid Response data management, data modeling, key control settings and analytics, with the exposure to integrating legacy data, or spreadsheets and data management in

Kinaxis Rapid Response.

* Hands-on experience maintaining Kinaxis Solutions & Environments and configuring Workbooks, Worksheets, Reports, Forms and Scripts in Rapid Response based on the solution design requirements.
* Deep knowledge in Kinaxis RR integration with SAP
* Candidates with domain knowledge in Retail/Wholesale Retail/Manufacturing preferred.
* Demonstrate excellent Business Process knowledge with strong people skills to implement Kinaxis for new and existing businesses and from a Support and Sustenance standpoint.
* Any prior experience with similar planning applications is a nice to have like SAP IBP, o9, Blueyonder, others.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Salary: $100.00 - $120.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Experience:

* Software development: 1 year (Preferred)
* Salesforce: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Security Architect - US Remote - PM
description:
VerSprite Staffing is a subsidiary of VerSprite Cybersecurity. Specializing in technology staffing and utilizing a network of technical clients, VerSprite Staffing connects top level technical talent with industry clients through various methods and expands not only clients talent network, but candidates job search as well. At the bottom line, VerSprite adds value to both clients and candidates alike.



We work with clients to fill both full-time and contracting opportunities, so If the following job interests you, please apply to learn more!

**Security Architect**



We are looking for a Security Architect to be responsible for the security design, code review, security testing, and implementation of security capabilities within the core product applications. The Security Architect's responsibilities include reviewing our current security measures, identifying areas of strength and weakness, recommending enhancements, assisting with compliance activities, and responding promptly to security incidents. You will also be responsible for conducting regular system tests and providing recommendations to teams for monitoring the security of their applications.



To be a successful Security Architect, you should be experienced in application security and risk assessment, with a strong understanding of security protocols, authentication and authorization patterns, cloud infrastructure security, and application security, both build time and runtime. You should also possess strong interpersonal and communication skills.


**Security Architect Job Responsibilities:**


* A thorough understanding of the organization's technology and IT systems.
* Planning, researching, and designing secure application architectures and CI/CD pipelines
* Developing, reviewing, and collaborating on the configuration of cloud account configuration, network isolation, security groups, access policies, network policies, VPNs, and overall compute platform security, including both host-based and container-based workloads.
* Integrating identity management systems, digital certificates, and secrets management with application workloads.
* Assessing security capabilities, evaluating tools and approaches, and making recommendations as part of the application security roadmap that is fed into team backlogs
* Reviewing vulnerabilities with teams and suggesting strategies and tactics for remediation.
* Validating security implementations and participating in remediation and risk acceptance efforts.
* Establishing disaster recovery procedures and conducting security breach drills.
* Responding quickly and effectively to all security incidents and providing post-event analyses.
* Guiding the overall security community, cultivating a sense of security awareness, and arranging for continuous education.
* Remaining up to date with the latest trends, standards, and products.


**Security Architect Requirements:**


* A bachelor's or associate's degree in IT, computer science, or equal experience.
* 5-10 years or more of experience in application development and
* Experience with AWS, including EKS, multi-account setups, GuardDuty, KMS, Config, SSM, CloudFront, Firewall Manager, Shield, Network Firewall, WAF, IAM, CloudTrail, Security Hub, Secrets Manager, Inspector, Global Accelerator, ELB, EC2, Athena
* A strong working knowledge of current application and infrastructure risks, secure application design, and operating systems including both Windows and Linux experience
* Excellent teaching, problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills.
* Knowledge of C-Sharp, JavaScript, Ruby, NodeJS, Go, Java, Kotlin, Swift, Python, bash, and SQL are

  



This is a 12 month full time contract work,

title: Product Architect
description:
**Reports to:** VP Engineering Technology


**Position Overview:**

The Product Architect for Data Operations provides practical, hands-on experience guiding the development of technology using current and emerging strategies, applications, and techniques around our organization’s data.


**Major Areas of Responsibility include:**


* Work closely with our product development team to define data requirements for any new products or enhancements.
* Analyze current systems including performance, size, and velocity of data, and contribute to solution designs.
* Support reporting and analysis directly through the use of business intelligence tools.
* Provide assistance to systems engineering, solutions, and support with respect to how data can be leveraged.
* Organize and lead communication across cross-functional teams.
* Ensure zero missed service level agreement conditions.
* Analytical skills, critical ability and attention to detail.
* High level understanding of business processes.
* Leverage internal and external resources to research service interruptions, vulnerabilities, and intelligence on various updates and enhancements that will improve our operational efficiency. Develop and maintain automated SOPs for maximum availability and security, in coordination with the IT Security team.
* Work with our Enterprise Security, Threat Intelligence and Digital Forensics and Incident Response (DFIR) Teams to identify threats, develop or recommend countermeasures to our clients, and perform advanced network and host analysis in the event of a compromise.


**Experience Required:**  

* Experience working on SQL databases; preference for working with data warehouse technologies.
* Experience with major business intelligence tools, such as Tableau or Looker.
* Experience with at least one programming language, such as Python.
* Experience using agile methodologies.
 **Minimum Qualifications (Skills, Knowledge & Abilities):**  

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Computer/Software Engineering, or related field
* Experience in a data analyst, product analyst, or product management role
* Knowledge of data security, privacy, and common vulnerability remediation
 **Travel %:** 0 – 10%


**FLSA status: Exempt**


**Additional Abilities Required:**  

* This job operates in both an office and field setting, requiring mobility between locations and the routine use of a computer and other standard office equipment. The ability to lift or move up to 5 pounds, bend, reach, and perform manual tasks may also be required.
 **About The Cannabist Company:**



The Cannabist Company, formerly known as Columbia Care, is one of the largest and most experienced cultivators, manufacturers and providers of cannabis products and related services, with licenses in 16 U.S. jurisdictions. The Company operates 125 facilities including 94 dispensaries and 31 cultivation and manufacturing facilities, including those under development. Columbia Care, now The Cannabist Company, is one of the original multi-state providers of cannabis in the U.S. and now delivers industry-leading products and services to both the medical and adult-use markets. In 2021, the Company launched Cannabist, its retail brand, creating a national dispensary network that leverages proprietary technology platforms. The company offers products spanning flower, edibles, oils and tablets, and manufactures popular brands including Seed & Strain, Triple Seven, Hedy, gLeaf, Classix, Press and Amber.

  

Recognized for it comprehensive benefits, ongoing training opportunities and commitment to diversity and equity inclusion both internally and with external vendors, The Cannabist Company has earned a spot on mg Magazine’s America’s Top Cannabis Industry Employers list.

  

The Cannabist Company provides full-time employees with an excellent benefits and compensation package including but not limited to competitive wages, paid holidays, vacation and sick time, 401K with company match, multiple health plan choices, dental, vision, pet and life insurances, 100% paid short-term disability, optional long-term disability insurance and more!

title: Azure Cloud Architect
description:
**Cloud Architect** 

**Remote**

**\\*Candidates MUST be able to come onsite (Richmond, VA) to pick up laptop, .**

Azure Cloud Trainer/Developer/Architect is a versatile role that combines the responsibilities of developing and delivering Gitlab/DevOps training programs with the hands-on work of developing and maintaining Gitlab tools, pipeline, and infrastructure including Microsoft ASP.NET/WebApi development. Secondly, the candidate will convert existing ASP.NET WebForm, MVC, Core applications on prem to High Available systems in Azure GCC cloud including developing Gitlab Pipelines, adopt/establish Agile methodology to the software development life cycle, and train development teams the whole process.

The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of DevOps/Agile principles and practices, as well as experience developing and delivering training materials and coding skills in multiple programming languages.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Training:
* Develop and deliver Gitlab/Agile training programs for internal audiences
* Develop and deliver Gitlab/Visual Studio Code training programs for internal audiences
* Create and maintain training materials, including presentations, handouts, and exercises
* Evaluate the effectiveness of training programs and provide feedback to participants
* Stay up-to-date on the latest Gitlab/DevOps trends and technologies
* Development:
* Develop and maintain Gitlab tools, Gitlab Pipelines, and infrastructure
* Develop and maintain Microsoft .NET C# ASP.NET, WebApi applications
* Deploy, migrate and maintain IIS to Azure Cloud, App Service, SQL Database, Key Vault
* Automate Gitlab/DevOps processes using scripting languages and automation tools
* Troubleshoot and resolve Gitlab/DevOps issues
* Stay up-to-date on the latest DevOps tools and technologies
* Contribute to the development of DevOps documentation

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
* 5+ years of experience in Gitlab/DevOps
* 5+ years of experience in Microsoft .NET Development(ASP.NET, MVC, WebApi,IIS)
* 3+ years of experience in Powershell and Shell scripting
* Proven experience developing and delivering training materials
* Excellent communication and presentation skills
* Strong technical writing skills and documentation experience
* Experience with a variety of DevOps tools and technologies, including but not limited to:
* Visual Studio Code
* Visual Studio
* Git
* Docker
* API tools , for example, Postman
* Oracle database
* SQL Server Database
* Azure
* GCP
* Serena PVCS Version Manager
* HP Quality Center
* Kanban board
* Experience with multiple computer languages, such as C#, T-SQL, PL/SQL,Shell Script, Powershell, and YAML

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience with Agile methodologies
* Experience with Azure cloud
* Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes
* Experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines
* Experience with DevOps automation tools such as Ansible or Flyway or ApexSQL DevOps

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $137,035.80 - $165,032.34 per year

Experience:

* Azure: 4 years (Preferred)
* ASP.NET: 5 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Infrastructure Architect
description:
My name is Akash Kumar and I am a Staffing Specialist at Tekshapers Inc. I am reaching out to you on an exciting job opportunity with one of our clients.

**Job - Infrastructure Architect**

**Type - Contract** 

**Location - Remote**

**Description –** 

Responsible for Platform Infrastructure Transition and Transformation Management, platform templates and delivery of infrastructure solutions for our enterprise client mission-critical systems. Delivery responsibilities includes management of solution template by platform and also includes infrastructure reference architecture participation, delivery management, implementation scheduling and coordination, financials and contractual support.

We are looking for candidates with a broad background of infrastructure architecture and delivery best practices, including cloud delivery. Resource must demonstrate proven track-record in infrastructure service delivery for business and the ability to learn quickly as technology advances new innovations and offerings enter the market.

**Job Responsibilities -**

* Establishment of Transition and Transformation management processes. Creating/maintaining a reference and standards document
* Establishing Platform templates supporting key dimensions (availability, security, performance, events monitoring, etc…).
* Participation in architecture initiatives, build roadmaps for continuous modernization of Enterprise Application platforms
* Implement infrastructure solutions per reference architecture, contractual and security requirements.
* Ensure that all Infrastructure issues, delays, or client concerns are resolved on a timely basis or escalated to upper management.
* Act as SME between IT Service Provider and Application / Business units
* Standard Operating Procedures for daily interaction with IT implementation partners
* Participate during Incident resolution and RCA
* Subject matter expert for applications, business functions and active liasoning resource between the business community including communications, planning and execution
* Maintain individual expertise by staying abreast of industry trends, reviewing industry publications, emerging trends and compliance
* Help create and maintain disaster recovery processes and technology
* Review/modernize/modify configuration, installation, maintenance, and backup processes for data protection

**Specific Requirements -** 

* 10+ years of overall IT / technical services experience with Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field of Information Technology
* Platform and infrastructure architecture experience – Cloud, Hybrid and Private hosting
* Excellent understanding of ITIL processes, IT systems infrastructure and best practices.
* Project management experience in an infrastructure oriented environment
* Capable of working in a growth oriented environment, with ability to manage and prioritize multiple concurrent requests, projects, and responsibilities
* Proven track record of leveraging vendor and consultant expertise for IT project delivery and support
* Strong analytical, problem solving and judgement skills
* Leadership and Customer facing skills
* Excellent Verbal and Written Communication skills
* Fundamental understanding of the following technology areas:
* Compute and Networking (LAN, WAN, WLAN)
* Storage (SAN) and Backup
* Virtualization (Server and Storage), Public, Hybrid and Private clouds
* Web Technology (Web Servers, Application Servers, Load Balancers)
* Security technology and processes - e.g. firewalls, intrusion prevention, compliance monitoring, vulnerability management
* Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Planning
* Capacity Planning
* High Availability
* Well versed with Infrastructure financials operations
* High-level understanding of specific technologies:
* Cloud – Microsoft Azure, AWS, GCP or Oracle Cloud
* Cisco UCS
* Microsoft Windows and Linux Operating Systems
* Cisco Network Gear
* EMC/3-PAR
* VMware / Oracle Virtualization
* Veeam / Symantec NetBackup
* Preferred Skillset –
* VCP3/VCP4 certification
* ITIL V3 Certification
* MCSE, CISSP, CISA or CISM is plus.

Job Type: Contract

Salary: $60.00 - $70.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Experience:

* ITIL: 10 years (Preferred)
* Cloud infrastructure: 10 years (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: AWS Cloud Architect (REMOTE)
description:
**Kadiak**
**Job ID 24200044**
**Kadiak, LLC,** a Koniag Government Services company**,** is seeking an AWS Cloud Architect with a Top-Secret Security Clearance to support **Kadiak** and our government customer. **This is a Remote opportunity.**
We offer competitive compensation and an extraordinary benefits package including health, dental and vision insurance, 401K with company matching, flexible spending accounts, paid holidays, three weeks paid time off, and more.
Assists other engineers and the Government in requirements engineering, solutions engineering, scheduling, reliability, resiliency, services development, integration, test and evaluation, maintainability, and analysis.
**Essential Functions, Responsibilities & Duties may include, but are not limited to:**
* Participate in technical project review meetings to ensure technical designs meet the client’s operational requirements and infrastructure/security standards.
* Provision and maintain cloud resources for an enterprise cloud environment (network, storage, compute)
* Automate infrastructure migrations to cloud environments and identify on-premises technologies and their cloud counterparts.
* Ensure compliance with incidents, problems, and change management procedures and execute ticket-based requests with little or no additional help.
* Focus on results and be delivery oriented, with a keen interest in quality and the ability to meet deadlines.

**Work Experience, Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**
* Top Secret DoD Clearance Required Must have a valid Driver’s License.
* At least 4 years of progressive experience administering, designing, and engineering cloud solutions.
* Sound fundamental knowledge of cloud technology and enterprise IT systems.
* Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills with experience exercising mature judgment.
* Experience deploying resources into and running workloads in Amazon Web Services and/or Microsoft Azure
* Ability to clearly translate technical requirements and concepts in a manner that appeals to a wide audience.
* Experience working independently with minimal supervision and guidance.
* Experience with operating systems and software: upgrade planning and implementation.
* Fundamental knowledge of and experience working in a DevOps centric environment
* Experience with CI/CD pipelines, automation tools, code promotion processes and methodologies.
* Experience with scripting languages such as python, json, YAML or others.
* Experience with deploying infrastructure as code using AWS CloudFormation templates, Azure ARM templates, Chef, Terraform or other automation tools.
* BS degree in Computer Science. Engineering, or related field, or equivalent experience

**Preferred, Not required:**
* Amazon Web Services Associate or Professional Level certifications
* Microsoft Azure Solutions Architect, Developer, DevOps Engineer or similar
* Working Knowledge of Systems Administration in Windows and Linux
* Foundational knowledge of AWS Services including but not limited to EC2, RDS, S3, EBS and IAM.
* Working familiarity with Scripting Languages such as Python, PowerShell, and Bash

**Working Environment & Conditions**
This job operates in a professional office environment and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets and fax machines.
This position is primarily indoors, consistent with a standard office position and has a noise level of mostly low to moderate. The incumbent is required to stand, walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; reach with hands and arms; talk and hear. The workload may require the incumbent to sit for extended periods of time. The incumbent must be able to read, do simple math calculations and withstand moderate amounts of stress.
The incumbent must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 lbs. Specific vision abilities required by the job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.
**Our Equal Employment Opportunity Policy**
The company is an equal opportunity employer. The company shall not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity (except where gender is a bona fide occupational qualification), national origin, age, disability, military/veteran status, marital status, genetic information, or any other factor protected by law. We are committed to equal employment opportunity in all decisions related to employment, promotion, wages, benefits and all other privileges, terms, and conditions of employment.
The company is dedicated to seeking all qualified applicants. If you require accommodation to navigate or to apply for a position on our website, please contact Heaven Wood via e-mail at accommodations@koniag-gs.com or by calling 703-488-9377 to request accommodation.
Koniag Government Services (KGS) is an Alaska Native Owned corporation supporting the values and traditions of our native communities through an agile employee and corporate culture that delivers Enterprise Solutions, Professional Services and Operational Management to Federal Government Agencies. As a wholly owned subsidiary of Koniag, we apply our proven commercial solutions to a deep knowledge of Defense and Civilian missions to provide forward leaning technical, professional, and operational solutions. KGS enables successful mission outcomes for our customers through solution-oriented business partnerships and a commitment to exceptional service delivery. We ensure long-term success with a continuous improvement approach while balancing the collective interests of our customers, employees, and native communities. For more information, please visit www.koniag-gs.com.
**Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled. Shareholder Preference in accordance with Public Law 88-352**

title: Microsoft 365 Solutions Architect
description:
What sets us apart from other property management companies? We’re innovators and change-makers who challenge the status quo. Haven Residential (Rebranding to 29th Street Communities) is a next-generation, full-service property management company with a wealth of industry experience in real estate operations, revenue management, marketing, leasing, and new development lease-up.


We understand that attracting top talent to join our team is key to our success and offer a competitive benefits package of **15 Paid Vacation Days, 6 Paid Sick Days, 11 Paid Holidays, Immediate Eligibility for Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Health Savings Account, Short Term Disability, Basic Life Insurance, Pet Insurance, Tuition Reimbursement, 401K and more!**

**The Role...**


The **Microsoft 365 Solutions Architect** will be responsible for the strategic design, development, and implementation of solutions within the Microsoft 365 platform. This position will play a pivotal role in elevating productivity, collaboration, and operational efficiency by working closely with cross-functional teams to create user-friendly solutions that are scalable and align with business/organization evolving needs while driving successful adoption. The Microsoft 365 Solutions Architect will be at the forefront of designing, customizing, and implementing dynamic solutions across SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive, Power Apps, Power Automate, Yammer, and other integral Microsoft 365 components. **This is a hybrid role that will allow flexibility to work both in the office and remotely.**

**The Essential Job Functions..**

* Architect, design, and plan M365 migrations (tenant-to-tenant) including test and remediation plans and work closely with teams and vendors to facilitate successful migrations and wide-scale overhaul while minimizing end-user disruption.
* Lead the design and implementation including planning, and deployment of Microsoft 365 collaboration and application solutions. Ensure proper integration with existing systems and platforms.
* Develop training materials and deliver training sessions to end-users, promoting the effective use of Microsoft 365 collaboration tools. Drive user adoption and change management strategies to ensure maximum utilization of the platform's features and capabilities.
* Collaborate with internal business teams to understand their collaboration requirements and translate them into effective Microsoft 365 solutions. Advise and develop solutions, workflows, and best practices to address common business challenges within our workforce
* Identifies potential points of integration between M365 services on the core device-top and works with technical colleagues to deliver key integrations.
* Design and implement automated workflows using tools like SharePoint Designer and Power Automate, ensuring seamless and efficient processes.
* Facilitates the development of custom web parts, extensions, and add-ins using SharePoint Framework (SPFx) and other appropriate technologies, expanding the functionality of Microsoft 365 applications.
* Generate comprehensive technical documentation, including architecture diagrams, coding guidelines, and user manuals, to guide the smooth implementation and maintenance of solutions.
* Work closely with Security team to establish governance policies, security controls, and compliance standards for Microsoft 365 collaboration tools. Monitor and enforce these policies to maintain data integrity, confidentiality, and availability.
* Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to end-users, addressing issues related to Microsoft 365 tools and solutions. Act as a subject matter expert and collaborate with IT support teams to resolve complex problems.
* Stay up to date with the latest Microsoft 365 collaboration tools, features, and industry best practices. Identify opportunities for process improvement and propose innovative solutions to enhance collaboration capabilities.
* Ensures vendors provide proper levels of support, maintain SLA’s, and provide root cause analysis for escalated issues.
* Ensures all team, departmental and firm policies and procedures are adhered to, including technical change management and service continuity.

**What you'll offer..**

* Deep understanding and extensive knowledge of the functionality, interdependencies and infrastructure of the Microsoft 365 family of products including Teams, OneDrive, SharePoint, Exchange, and Power Platform
* Proven expertise in security and compliance related to Microsoft 365 collaboration technologies
* In-depth experience of business process analysis
* Working knowledge of Azure AD and familiarity with scripting languages
* Ability to collaborate with key technical staff to design solutions that meet business requirements
* Ability to manage all aspects and phases of solution delivery, including discovery, design, implementation/execution, support, and maintenance
* Proficiency in web technologies such as SharePoint Framework (SPFx), JavaScript, TypeScript, HTML, and CSS.
* Proficiency in PowerShell scripting for automation and administration
* Proficiency in Power Apps, Power Automate, and Power Virtual Agent.
* Skilled in SharePoint, SPFx, Teams App development, Graph API, Governance, Administration, and SharePoint migration.
* Familiarity with Angular JS, .Net, BOT Framework, REST API, Azure DevOps, and Voltage.
* Ability to meet critical deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Expert analytical and problem-solving skills; ability to provide root cause analysis and demonstrate results through testing and metrics.
* Strong project management skills, with the ability to multi-task, manage multiple projects, and meet deadlines.
* Ability to manage and prioritize multiple projects while adhering to deadlines and budgets.

title: Senior Solutions Architect
description:
NewtekOne®, ((NASDAQ: NEWT) Your Business Solutions Company®, is a financial holding company, which along with its bank and non-bank consolidated subsidiaries, provides a wide range of business and financial solutions under the Newtek® brand to the small- and medium-sized business ("SMB") market. Since 1999, Newtek has provided state-of-the-art, cost-efficient products and services and efficient business strategies to SMB relationships across all 50 states to help them grow their sales, control their expenses, and reduce their risk.


Newtek's and its subsidiaries' business and financial solutions include banking (Newtek Bank, N.A.), Business Lending, Electronic Payment Processing, Technology Solutions (Cloud Computing, Data Backup, Storage and Retrieval, IT Consulting), eCommerce, Accounts Receivable Financing & Inventory Financing, Insurance Solutions, Web Services, and Payroll and Benefits Solutions.


Newtek Technology Solutions (NTS) is a key part of NewtekOne. We provide a complete range of IT managed services, secure private cloud hosting, backup and disaster recovery, and full web eCommerce solutions. NTS has specialized in helping businesses leverage technology to drive innovation for over three decades.


Our team has the expertise and experience leveraging a broad range of technology solutions and services that enable your business to operate more efficiently and securely. When working on a project with NTS, clients receive unmatched engagement experience - from concept to execution.


For more than 30 years NTS has been the IT force behind some of the most globally recognized brands. We have tens of thousands of customers across the Americas, EMEA, Asia and Australia. To accommodate the needs of our global clientele, our operations are geographically distributed throughout several missions' critical data center. This vast range allows us to meet almost any applications proximity, common disaster recovery use case, and in-region data residency.


Our advanced proficiencies and partnerships with industry leaders including DellEMC, Microsoft, Citrix, and VMWare, just to name a few, enable companies to communicate and interact securely from work, home, or on the road.


As more and more businesses consider moving key components and other operations to the cloud, NTS is there to make the transition seamless. We support businesses on every step of the journey, from review, to design, to procurement, to installation and implementation, to ongoing support.


We are seeking a Sr. Solutions Architect, to join our Solutions Team. We are looking for a true IT Generalist that is comfortable speaking to and designing solutions for a broad spectrum of technologies ranging from hardware to private cloud. These design solutions include private and public cloud hosting, backup & disaster recovery, consulting/practice management, managed IT services, professional services, and procurement hardware & software sales. You will apply a blend of technical expertise and business intelligence while interacting daily with multiple customers to define, design, and help sell innovative technical solutions that are specially tailored to exceed customer expectations.


**Job responsibilities include but are not limited to:**
========================================================

* Lead customer discovery and brainstorming calls to gather requirements and perform high level systems and business impact analysis for requested
* Work closely with Sales Executives to accurately identify customer needs and ensure proper solutions are
* Develop and deliver targeted & specific solutions to enterprise executives and decision
* End to End validated best practices solution design leveraging input from multiple sources both internal and
* Creation of detailed Statements of Work that accurately convey all aspects of the solutions implementation and related level of effort
* Solution handoff to internal implementation teams for delivery
* Develop and maintain relationships with key client technical
* Identify, research, and keep apprised of emerging technologies, solutions, strategies, and developments across the technology spectrum with the goal of identifying strategic opportunities for
* Interact with account management, project management, and delivery teams with a focus on continuous process
* Identify and maintain key relationships with vendors/partners while ensuring requirements are met to maintain

**Qualifications include but not limited to:**
==============================================

* High school diploma with equivalent experience and a minimum of 10 years of related experience. Bachelor's degree in computer science, Engineering, or related technical field preferred.
* Prior working experience of at least 7 years at a managed service provider plus.
* 5 years of experience in architecting, designing, and deploying technical network solutions in a large-scale complex environment.
* Related infrastructure architect and presales skills.
* Desired certifications (any one or more): Azure Fundamentals, AWS Cloud Practitioner, VMWare: VTSP or VTSP for AWS/Azure, ITIL: Version 3 or later.
* Expert level understanding of virtualization, hybrid computing environments, storage technology and cloud native technologies.
* Demonstrates proactive behaviors and self-management techniques, including but not limited to, working efficiently, demonstrating adaptability, and setting goals.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills.
* Demonstrates ability to develop new ideas, concepts, and solutions to meet new requirements, unarticulated needs, or existing needs.
* Ability to facilitate workshops with clients and NTS teams to discover requirements, present solutions and obtain client buy-in.


Are you self-motivated and looking for a job where you can be part of a collaborative team that will give you the tools for innovation and growth? If so, come join the growing and talented Systems Support Engineer Team at Newtek Technology Solutions.


The position is remote working from home.


Newtek offers competitive salary and a performance-based bonus program to reward your results. We provide our employees with an excellent comprehensive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, supplemental benefits, and a 401(k) savings plan with an employer match. On-going training on technology, sales techniques, industry, and competitive landscape to support your career growth.


Newtek is an Equal Opportunity Employer; M/F/D/V. We require all our employees to perform work in an ethical manner and always uphold our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics.

title: Microsoft Solutions Architect
description:
**Job Description:**  
We are currently seeking a highly experienced Microsoft Domain Migration Consultant to join our team on a short-term basis. The ideal candidate will be responsible for conducting a thorough discovery assessment of our current Microsoft domain environment, identifying all necessary requirements for a successful migration. This role requires a strategic thinker with extensive knowledge in Microsoft domain architectures and migration strategies.

**Responsibilities:**

* Conduct a comprehensive discovery assessment of the current Microsoft domain setup, including all associated systems, applications, and data.
* Identify potential challenges, risks, and dependencies associated with the migration process.
* Develop a detailed migration strategy and playbook, outlining step-by-step processes, timelines, resource requirements, and best practices.
* Provide high-level architectural guidance and recommendations to ensure a seamless and efficient migration process.
* Collaborate closely with IT teams to ensure understanding and alignment with the migration strategy.
* Offer expert advice on mitigating risks and addressing potential issues during the migration.
* Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards throughout the migration process.
* Deliver regular progress reports and updates to senior management and stakeholders.

**Requirements:**

* Proven experience as a Microsoft Domain Migration Consultant or similar role, with a strong portfolio of successful domain migration projects.
* Deep knowledge of Microsoft domain architectures, Active Directory, and related technologies.
* Expertise in migration tools and methodologies specific to Microsoft environments.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to conduct detailed technical assessments and develop effective migration strategies.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
* Familiarity with regulatory standards and compliance requirements related to data protection and migration.
* Professional certifications in Microsoft technologies (e.g., MCSE, MCSA) are highly desirable.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and deadlines efficiently.

Job Types: Part-time, Contract, Temporary

Pay: $66.16 - $79.68 per hour

Expected hours: 20 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance

Application Question(s):

* How many years of experienced do you have as a Microsoft Solutions Architect?

Work Location: Remote

title: Microsoft 365 Architect
description:
**Microsoft 365 A****rchitect**


**Job Overview**


Inviso is looking for a subject matter expert in Security, Compliance, Identity, and Enterprise device management under the Microsoft 365 umbrella. This candidate would join our Infrastructure and Security team to lead our end customers through modernization of endpoints and embracing Microsoft’s Zero Trust security model. This position will focus on designing, implementing, maintaining, and supporting security and compliance solutions leveraging Microsoft tooling. We are looking for a strong customer-facing solution architect with deep expertise in the Microsoft 365 security stack.


This position will work remotely and be available to work hours in support of the North America time zones.


**Responsibilities**


* Draft proposed solutions/implementations for various customer scenarios that leverage advanced features of the latest Microsoft Security offerings to strengthen security posture.
* Develop repeatable deployment plans for Microsoft Security, Compliance & Identity offerings.
* Create reusable processes and materials to guide initial assessment of customer environments. This may include questionnaires, checklists, or sample commentary to use during initial customer calls and workshops.
* Oversee the implementation of provided solutions by onshore, nearshore, and offshore engineering teams.
* Build proofs of concept and sample environments to demonstrate Microsoft 365 offerings.
* Function as the technical product owner of the Microsoft 365 Security & Infrastructure offerings for our practice.
* Perform configuration and management of Windows-based corporate systems and personal mobile devices via Microsoft Intune on customer environments.
* Configuration and management of Microsoft Autopilot to set up and pre-configure new devices, getting them ready for productive use.
* Build and maintain automation to manage the on prem and cloud infrastructure related to Microsoft 365, Entra ID, and Active Directory.
* Configuration and deployment of Azure Virtual Desktop and/or Windows 365.
* Configure and monitor cloud infrastructure (including Intune, Autopilot, Azure Virtual Desktop, etc.)
* Troubleshoot and repair complex technical problems with team members, customers, and vendors quickly and effectively.
* Research competing third party products to identify feature parity with Microsoft Security, Compliance & Identity offerings.


**Qualifications**


* Background in Professional Services / Consulting delivery.
* Can demonstrate 5+ years’ experience with all aspects of solution design, implementation, maintenance, and support of one or more of the following Microsoft Security, Compliance & Identity products: Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Defender, Entra ID Premium (Risk Based Conditional Access, PIM, MFA), Windows Hello for Business.
* Can demonstrate experience with solution design, implementation, maintenance and support of Windows 365 and Azure Virtual Desktop
* Minimum of 5 years’ experience working in an Enterprise IT environment.
* A trusted Technical Advisor to customers and internal team. Ability to share knowledge and strengthen our team.
* Ability to work independently, as part of a team or in a lead role.
* Excellent organizational skills with the ability to work effectively on multiple priorities with firm delivery dates.
* Effective communication skills within information technology and business environments.
* Customer and quality focused individual.
* Proven record of guiding customers through the Modern Workplace journey, providing recommended best practices and driving execution.
* System/Program Specific Experience:
	+ Firm understanding of the Microsoft 365 security and identity components.
	+ Experience within a large-scale Windows Enterprise customer/employer.
	+ Solid understanding of Hybrid Azure Active Directory and Active Directory Federation Services.
	+ Experience with PowerShell, PowerShell Workflow and troubleshooting PowerShell ISE
	+ Identity Management (Active Directory, EntraID, Microsoft Identity Manager/FIM).
	+ Windows Hello for Business.

**About Inviso:** *Inviso is a premier consulting firm that delivers business solutions through Solution Assessment, Azure Infrastructure, Modern Work & Security, Data & Analytics, Business Process Automation, Cloud Cost & License Optimization, Staffing, and Marketing. We are an entrepreneurial, agile organization with a broad range of business experience and talents, and a laser focus on adding value for our customers. With headquarters in Seattle, and additional locations around the world, we assist thousands of customers across the globe.*

title: Azure Cloud Infrastructure Architect - 100% remote
description:
Cloud AI Infrastructure engineering involves the design, deployment, maintenance, and servicing of Cloud infrastructure underpinning AI and Machine Learning (ML) SaaS implementations for safe and secure construction and deployment of AI services by AI and ML engineers. Rather than building the data models or implementing the AI service, Cloud AI Infrastructure engineering creates safe spaces for AI engineers to build data models which enable ChatBots, AI Search, Machine Learning and similar services which are performant for thousands of users, avoiding data leakage between models and services.

Required Qualifications

· 6+ years of experience in Azure cloud environments.

· Microsoft Azure Certified Solution Architect

· Microsoft Azure Certified AI Fundamentals

· Customer focused with experience leading technical discussions with stakeholders and driving solutions to successful implementations.

· 3+ years of experience using the Azure CLI, PowerShell Az, and ARM templates to deploy, configure, and manage Azure resources.

· Highly experienced in implementing and troubleshooting foundational Azure services (virtual machines, storage, networking, monitoring, databases, etc.).

· Experience generating complex automation supporting systems administration of cloud services

· Familiarity with AI Cloud Concepts

Preferred Qualifications

· At least two Associate-level (or higher) Microsoft Cloud certifications such as Azure Solution Architect, Azure AI Engineer Associated, or Azure Network Engineer

· Team player, confident and enthusiastic; proven partner engagement and cross-team collaboration skills.

· Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to simplify and explain complex ideas.

· Experience writing and maintaining clear and concise technical documentation.

· Expert level knowledge in Azure Core Services.

· Experience implementing Azure Cloud environments consisting of multiple services in line with the Microsoft Well Architected Framework.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $170,000.00 - $245,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 6 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Director, Enterprise Architecture
description:
**About AGC Biologics**  

AGC Biologics is a leading global biopharmaceutical Contract Development and Manufacturing Organization (CDMO) with a strong commitment to delivering the highest standard of service as we work side-by-side with our clients and partners, every step of the way. We provide world-class development and manufacture of mammalian and microbial-based therapeutic proteins, plasmid DNA (pDNA), messenger RNA (mRNA), viral vectors, and genetically engineered cells. Our global network spans the U.S., Europe, and Asia, with cGMP-compliant facilities in Seattle, Washington; Boulder and Longmont, Colorado; Copenhagen, Denmark; Heidelberg, Germany; Milan, Italy; and Chiba, Japan. We currently employ more than 2,500 employees worldwide. Our commitment to continuous innovation fosters the technical creativity to solve our clients' most complex challenges, including specialization in fast-track projects and rare diseases. AGC Biologics is the partner of choice. To learn more, visit www.agcbio.com.

  


**JOB SUMMARY**



We are seeking a highly skilled and dedicated Director, Enterprise Architecture to join our team. As Director, Enterprise Architecture, you will play a critical role in the success of our Information Technology strategy, operational platform, and of strategic initiatives that involve our system architecture.

  


**ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Proactively and holistically champions technical/operational transformation and optimization initiatives.
* Leads the development of a value proposition and execution of a communication and education plan for the enterprise architecture practice.
* Develops and deploys a prioritized roadmap for the overall enterprise architecture approach for the organization, and communicates it effectively across key stakeholder groups.
* Effectively promotes the business value of Enterprise Architecture as an enabler of strategy formulation, and as support for technology innovation.
* Leads the creation of the Enterprise Architecture ('EA') sub-function, ensuring consistent progress in the development of the organization, its ways of working, standard processes, and success measures.
* Leads the development of the EA service portfolio, ensuring it is aligned to the needs of the organization and to the needs of EA's key stakeholders.
* Translates and executes business strategy to achieve the organization's targeted business outcomes by leading the development of an implementation roadmap for the enterprise architecture.
* Constructs technology-enabled business and operating models and provides viable options and visibility into execution issues.
* Facilitates business and IT alignment through a collaborative, supportive and consultative manner, driving the organization's digital business strategies and balancing innovation and growth.
* Collaborates with delivery teams to ensure consistency with the enterprise architecture and to leverage shared technologies, tools and processes that impact speed to value and time to market.
* Collaborates with infrastructure teams to ensure consistency with the enterprise architecture, as well as to identify when it is necessary to modify the enterprise architecture.
* Recruits and develops the critical skills, competencies and career paths for the EA team members; in particular, building the business and behavioral competencies needed to support the success of the group
* Provides ongoing coaching and mentoring to members of the EA team.
* Helps the enterprise find the right balance between enterprise risk and agility. Communicates key EA positions to business and IT leaders on an ongoing basis to get, and maintain, buy-in and alignment.

  


**LEADERSHIP & KEY SKILLS**


* Strong leadership skills with exceptional soft and interpersonal skills, including teamwork, facilitation, collaboration and negotiation.
* Deep understanding of existing, new and emerging technologies, and processing environments.
* In-depth knowledge of business ecosystems, SaaS, infrastructure as a service (IaaS), platform as a service (PaaS), service-oriented architecture (SOA), APIs, open data, microservices, event-driven IT and predictive analytics.
* In-depth knowledge of information management practices, system development life cycle management, IT services management, agile and lean methodologies, infrastructure and operations, and EA and ITIL frameworks.
* Understanding of the different types of agile principles, methodologies and frameworks, especially those designed to be scaled at the enterprise level.

  


**QUALIFICATIONS**

**Required:**


* Bachelor's degree in business, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering or a related field of study, or equivalent experience required.
* 8+ years of business experience in strategic and operations planning and/or business analysis; and/or
* 8+ years of experience in at least three disciplines, such as business, information, solution or technical architecture or application development in a multitier environment.

  


**Preferred:**


* Master's degree in business, computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or related field.

  


**COMPENSATION RANGE: $164,400 – $226,050**



Fluctuations in the job market may necessitate adjustments to pay ranges. Final pay determinations will depend on various factors, including, but not limited to experience levels, knowledge, skills, and abilities.



Benefits available to Team Members include subsidized insurance for the Team Member and designated dependents (medical, vision, dental, life and disability), eligibility to participate in the AGC Biologics 401(k) plan (including a generous matching contribution from the company and immediate vesting), vacation, sick time, and parental leave.



Team Members are also eligible to receive a discretionary annual bonus commensurate to the level of the role. The payout is based on both the company's performance and the Team Member's performance.

  


*AGC Biologics offers a highly competitive compensation package and a friendly, collaborative culture that values personal initiative and professional achievement. AGC Biologics is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.*

title: Solutions Architect
description:
What We Need
  
FLEETCOR is currently looking to hire a Solutions Architect within our CORPAY line of business. In this role, you'll be instrumental in sculpting the technological future of our payment solutions. Your mission will encompass the crafting and deployment of robust, scalable, and secure architectures, underpinned by C#/.NET frameworks, Java, and leveraging premier cloud services provided by Azure and AWS. Your expertise will not only enhance our operational capabilities but also ensure our offerings remain at the pinnacle of industry standards.
  
How We Work
  
As a Solutions Architect, you will be expected to work in a remote environment. FLEETCOR will set you up for success by providing:
  
  

* Company-issued equipment
* Monthly home internet stipend


Role Responsibilities
  
  

**The responsibilities of the role will include:**  

* Architect and implementing exemplary, scalable, and resilient solutions utilizing C#/.NET, Java, and cloud technologies from Azure and AWS.
* Promoting and applying event-driven and bus-style architectural paradigms to boost application scalability, performance, and business agility.
* Collaborating closely with cross-disciplinary teams to ensure architectural designs are in lockstep with business objectives and product strategy.
* Providing technical leadership and mentorship to development teams, fostering a culture of excellence in development practices, design patterns, and technology utilization.
* Driving the adoption of Azure DevOps and AWS services to optimize CI/CD pipelines, enhancing deployment efficiency and product quality.
* Undertaking comprehensive technology evaluations, advocating for the integration of novel technologies and tools where beneficial.
* Embedding security considerations deeply into all architectural designs, adhering to stringent industry and regulatory standards.
* Actively participating in code reviews, architectural deliberations, and strategic planning sessions to ensure alignment with technical and business goals.


Qualifications & Skills
  
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, engineering, or a related discipline.
* Over 5 years of experience in software architecture and development, with profound expertise in C#/.NET and Java environments.
* Demonstrated proficiency with Azure and AWS cloud services, designing cloud-native and hybrid solutions.
* Deep knowledge of implementing event-driven and bus-style architectures, including understanding of messaging patterns and technologies.
* Experience with TypeScript and modern web development frameworks.
* Familiarity with Azure DevOps, AWS services, and CI/CD best practices.
* Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills, capable of transforming complex requirements into scalable technological solutions.
* Strong leadership and communication abilities, adept at mentoring developers and engaging with non-technical stakeholders.
* Background in a product-driven setting, with acute awareness of the impact of architectural decisions on product success.
* A fervent passion for technology, with a commitment to staying abreast of the latest trends and best practices in software architecture.


Benefits & Perks
  
* Medical, Dental & Vision benefits available the 1st month after hire
* Automatic enrollment into our 401k plan (subject to eligibility requirements)
* Virtual fitness classes offered company-wide
* Robust PTO offerings including: major holidays, vacation, sick, personal, & volunteer time
* Employee discounts with major providers (i.e. wireless, gym, car rental, etc.)
* Philanthropic support with both local and national organizations
* Fun culture with company-wide contests and prizes


Our Company & Purpose
  
FLEETCOR is a global leader in business payments, laser focused on developing smarter ways for businesses to pay their expenses. Since 2000, FLEETCOR has developed innovative digital solutions that help businesses better track, manage, and pay their expenses. Today, FLEETCOR is an S&P 500 company with hundreds of thousands of customers using our products in over 100 countries. Companies of all sizes, industries and geographies rely on our product portfolio to manage spending more quickly, efficiently and securely than ever before.
  
**We embrace a culture grounded in five key values:** integrity, collaboration, innovation, execution and people. These values offer you the opportunity to ‘thrive & grow’ through career development, volunteer, community, and wellness initiatives. This allows you to create a balance between professional goals and personal achievement.
  
FLEETCOR is also committed to building and nurturing a culture of diversity, inclusion, equality, and belonging by:
  
* Welcoming people of different backgrounds, cultures, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations;
* Empowering our people to share their experiences and ideas through open forums and individual conversations; and
* Valuing each person’s unique perspectives and individual contributions


Embracing diversity enables our people to “make the difference” as FLEETCOR and its more than 8,000 employees continue to shape the future of global payments. Learn more by visiting www.FLEETCOR.com or following FLEETCOR on LinkedIn.
  
Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer
  
FLEETCOR is an Equal Opportunity Employer. FLEETCOR provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, color, gender (including pregnancy), religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, language, ancestry, genetic information, veteran and/or military status or any other group status protected by federal or local law. If you require reasonable accommodation for the application and/or interview process, please notify a representative of the Human Resources Department.
  
For more information about our commitment to equal employment opportunity and pay transparency, please click the following links:  EEO and Pay Transparency

title: Architect - Microsoft Purview DLP Architect
description:

title: Network Architect
description:
About Us

We are a team of Architects, Senior Data, Application, and System Engineers, recognized for our elite capabilities in guiding clients worldwide through their digital transformation, data modernization, and cloud migration journeys. Our focus, predominantly in the data space, extends into a comprehensive array of services, including network infrastructure projects which are pivotal for our client's success in today's digital economy.

The Role

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated CCIE Network Infrastructure Engineer to join our team on a contract basis. This is a unique opportunity to work with an elite group of professionals on cutting-edge projects. The role is fully remote, offering the flexibility to work from anywhere, designed for an individual ready to make an immediate impact.

Duration & Availability

* **Contract Length:** 6-12 months, full-time engagement
* **Start Date:** Within 2-3 weeks from the job posting, with a preference for near-immediate availability

Key Responsibilities

* Design, implement, and manage complex network infrastructure projects with a strong focus on Cisco Nexus series (9500, 9600, 9300) and Cisco ITD.
* Develop and maintain high-security network environments, incorporating Palo Alto firewalls and advanced load balancing techniques.
* Work closely with clients to architect and deploy network infrastructure that supports digital transformation, data warehouse modernization, and cloud migration initiatives.
* Lead projects with minimal oversight, demonstrating a strong ability to manage time, resources, and project deliverables.
* Collaborate with a team of elite Architects, Engineers, and Analysts to deliver high-quality, scalable solutions.

Requirements

* **Certification:** Current CCIE certification is mandatory.
* **Experience:** Proven experience with Cisco Nexus 9500, 9600, 9300 series, and Cisco ITD. Strong background in managing Palo Alto firewalls and load balancing within complex environments.
* **Skills:** Exceptional technical, analytical, and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively in a fully remote setting. Strong communication and leadership qualities, capable of guiding teams and leading projects to success.
* **Contract Type:** Open to 1099 or Corporate-to-Corporate arrangements.

Ideal Candidate

The ideal candidate is a forward-thinking leader, eager to take charge and drive projects forward. You are highly experienced, with a knack for staying ahead in your field, constantly seeking opportunities for growth and development. Your expertise enables you to navigate complex environments with ease, making you a valuable asset to any project.

Why Join Us?

Joining our team means being part of an organization that values innovation and leadership. We offer a dynamic work environment where your contributions will directly impact our success and the success of our clients. This role is an excellent opportunity to expand your skills, work on challenging projects, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry.

Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: From $80.00 per hour

Expected hours: No less than 40 per week

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Referral program

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Work Location: Remote

title: ServiceNow Architect (Remote)
description:
FiDES is looking for a ServiceNow Solutions Architect for a contract position.
  
  

The ServiceNow Architect is responsible for collaborating with the client while adhering to industry standards for configuration, development, support and maintenance of the ServiceNow platform. You will work with stakeholders to understand, propose, and deliver solutions using ServiceNow best practices. The Architect will be responsible for designing the enterprise roadmap and working with the development team to implement effective solutions within the ServiceNow platform. Additionally, the role is responsible for including, but not limited to:
  
  

* Understanding business objectives and be able to identify implications to IT as it relates to application architecture and infrastructure.

* Identify bottlenecks and develop optimizations & customizations based on needs.

* Coordinate with client stakeholders and technical implementation team.

Requirements
  
  

* Certified (CSA) ServiceNow System Administrator
* 2-5 years of ServiceNow experience is a must
* Experience with ITSM, ITAM, CMDB, and Discovery within ServiceNow
* Understanding of the SaaS (software as a service) business & technology model
* Understanding and experience in configuration management principles
* Interest in learning and taking on increasingly complex tasks
* Excellent communications skills required - verbally with all levels of customer IT and business management, as well as written with technical assessments and project related reports
* Demonstrated self-direction and attention to detail with ability to work in a fast paced and changing environment with short deadlines
* Strong organization and process improvement skills Ability to work independently and as part of a team
* Communication skills to communicate at all levels of the organization

title: AI Architect
description:
**Position: AI Architect**

**Location: Remote (EST/CST)**

**Duration: Contract**

The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of AI and machine learning algorithms and the ability to design, develop and deploy AI solutions that address business problems. They will have excellent programming skills and be proficient in at least one of the major programming languages used in AI such as Python, Java, or C++.

**Responsibilities:**

· Collaborate with data scientists and other AI professionals to augment digital transformation efforts by identifying and piloting use cases.

· Align technical implementation with existing and future requirements by gathering inputs from multiple stakeholders — business users, data scientists, security professionals, data engineers and analysts, and those in IT operations

· Design and develop AI and machine learning algorithms and models that meet business requirements

· Strong knowledge of deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch

· Develop scalable and efficient algorithms and models that can be deployed in production environments

· Extensive knowledge of Big Data solutions like Apache Shark, Apache Hadoop, SQL, and NoSQL databases.

· Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure or Google Cloud

explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders like business unit executives

· Provide expert advice to determine options and solutions to project issues and challenges to ensure optimal service delivery and client satisfaction.

**Good to Have:**
