title: IT Solution Architect
description:
At Morgan & Morgan, the work we do matters. For millions of Americans, we're their last line of defense against insurance companies, large corporations or defective goods. From attorneys to client support staff, creative marketing to operations teams, every member of our firm has a key role to play in the winning fight for consumer rights. Our over 3,000 employees are all united by one mission: For the People.

**Generic Position Summary**
----------------------------



As a member of the professional staff, contributes specialized knowledge and skill in a discipline (e.g., Accounting, Finance, Human Resources, Information Technology, Operations Planning & Support, Sales & Marketing) area to support team and/or department business objectives. Generally, works under limited supervision, but within established guidelines, producing and analyzing more complex business information to lead the decision-making process.


**Specific Job Summary**
------------------------



The Solution Architect is a member of the global Digital Workplace Services team within the corporate IT function reporting to the Digital Workplace Director. This position may be staffed from our corporate office in either Orlando, FL or remote. This has responsibility for ensuring quality delivery of Digital Workplace services and solutions by researching, tracking, designing, packaging, testing, and deploying and integrating unified technical solutions, while also providing documentation, training, and communication to peers and colleagues throughout the IT support organization.


**Generic Expected Contributions**
----------------------------------


* Performs more complex quantitative and qualitative analysis for business processes and/or projects. Often manages small projects, business processes or parts of larger ones.
* Responds to, solves and makes decisions on more complex/non-routine business requests with limited to moderate risk.
* Responsible for own work and contributing to team, department and/or business results. May direct work of non-management staff.
* Assists more senior associates in achieving business results by:
	+ identifying opportunities to enhance the effectiveness of business processes.
	+ providing training and technical guidance to less senior staff, where appropriate, and serving as point-of-contact for problem resolution.
	+ participating in setting department operating plans.
	+ recognizing and celebrating team successes.
	+ achieving results against budget within scope of responsibility.
* Demonstrates an awareness of personal strengths and areas for improvement and acts independently to improve and increase skills and knowledge.
* Performs other duties as appropriate.

**Specific Expected Contributions**
-----------------------------------


* Design and document the architecture and technical specifications of SaaS solutions, following industry standards and best practices.
* Develop an understanding of existing IT solutions, evaluate and recommend technologies, tools, and frameworks to optimize the performance, availability, security and user experience.
* Collaborate with internal teams and select partners to understand business requirements and propose solutions that meet or exceed.
* Communicate and present the architecture and technical solutions to internal stakeholders, including senior leadership.
* Design defect detection and "confirmation of resolution" processes, ensuring that a standard approach is being followed throughout the larger Digital Workplace Services team.
* Lead training, documentation, and reinforcement of ITIL principles to other IT disciplines in support of the Digital Workplace Services team's objectives and to the betterment of the IT organization.
* Evaluate new technologies for compatibility, security compliance, and "fit for use".
* Create a sense of accountability within Digital Workplace Services team to foster a culture that "owns" misses and uses them to drive future process improvements.
* Provide after-hours support when needed for change implementation and/or incident management.

**Generic Candidate Profile**
-----------------------------



Successful candidates should possess knowledge and experience and demonstrate strong leadership and relationship skills as follows:


* Excellent analytical skills
* Knack for finding creative solutions
* Solid understanding of IT topics
* Keen attention to detail


Generally, a professional position with specific knowledge in a discipline (e.g., Accounting, Human Resources, Information Technology). College degree and/or relevant experience typically required.


**Specific Candidate Profile**
------------------------------


**Education**


* BS Degree or equivalent experience
* Two or more relevant technology industry certifications


**Experience**


* 5+ years Information experience as a solution architect, or similar role.
* Software quality or business analysis experience preferred.
* ITIL Foundation certification preferred.


**Skills/Attributes**


* Strong knowledge of SaaS architecture principles, patterns, and best practices.
* Experience with SaaS technologies and platforms.
* Ability to integrate and administer these applications, and connected hardware, within an enterprise environment.
* Able to design, develop and deploy the most complex solutions integrated across the enterprise.
* Knowledge of common scripting languages (i.e., PowerShell, Python, etc.) and techniques leading to repeatable quality results.
* Knowledge of common industry leading testing methodologies, with ability to design thorough engineering standards.
* Experience testing and deploying COTS, custom, and SaaS products.
* Technically able to design complex systems and know how to develop tests for them for business function.
* Impeccable communication skills are required. Adept at communicating the most complex technical topics to all levels of the organization and to a global audience through a wide range of formats (verbal, written, presentational, virtual, etc.).
* Advanced knowledge in the use of Microsoft Office tools (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Visio) to analyze data, convey complex visual information to a diverse audience.
* Able to work at a fast pace with others and with multiple project leaders.


#LI-MB1

**Benefits**



Morgan & Morgan is a leading personal injury law firm dedicated to protecting the people, not the powerful. This success starts with our staff. For full-time employees, we offer an excellent benefits package including medical and dental insurance, 401(k) plan, paid time off and paid holidays.


**Equal Opportunity Statement**



Morgan & Morgan provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.


**E-Verify**



This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the I-9 Form.


**Privacy Policy**



Here is a link to Morgan & Morgan's privacy policy.

title: IT Solutions Architect
description:
At Curriculum Associates (CA), we believe a diverse team leads to diversity in thinking, making our products better for teachers and students. If you read this job description, feel energized by what you see here, and believe you could bring passion and commitment to the role, but you aren’t sure you meet every qualification, please apply! Above all, we are looking for the right person!
At Curriculum Associates (CA), we believe a diverse team leads to diversity in thinking, making our products better for teachers and students. If you read this job description, feel energized by what you see here, and believe you could bring passion and commitment to the role, but you aren’t sure you meet every qualification, please apply! Above all, we are looking for the right person!
A Solution Architect plays a crucial role in designing and implementing comprehensive solutions that meet the business needs of an organization. This position involves a combination of technical expertise, strategic thinking, and effective communication skills. The Solution Architect collaborates with stakeholders, including business leaders and IT professionals, to understand requirements, assess existing systems, and develop scalable and efficient solutions.
The Impact You'll have:* Translates business and technical requirements into an architectural blueprint.
* Creates architectural designs to guide and contextualize solution development .
* Acts as a consultant on a broad range of technologies, platforms, and vendor offerings to drive targeted business outcomes.
* Provides End to End/Cross Functional Solution oversight and design.
* Leads evaluation, design and analysis for the implementation of new solutions architecture.
* Creates Solution Documentation for ‘as is’ systems.
* Oversees solution design activities for large projects and third-party vendors.
* Provides consulting support to Tech Leads within teams to ensure the project or product is aligned with the overall enterprise architecture.
* Propose enhancements to existing systems and processes to increase efficiency and effectiveness.
* Assists Enterprise Architect with EA duties, such as software evaluations, enterprise landscape documentation, and strategic initiatives.


Who we are looking for:* In-depth knowledge of software development methodologies, architecture, and design patterns.
* Proficiency in multiple programming languages and frameworks.
* Understanding of databases, data modeling, and data management.
* Knowledge of middleware and integration technologies.
* Ability to translate future-state business capabilities and requirements into solution architecture requirements and documentation.
* Understanding of security principles and best practices.
* Ability to design secure and compliant solutions.
* Ability to articulate new ideas and concepts to technical and nontechnical audiences.
* Familiarity with enterprise architecture frameworks such as TOGAF.
* Quick Problem solving for production escalations in area of expertise.
* Stays abreast of emerging technologies and assess their applicability to the organization's needs.
* Team player with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams.
* Flexibility and adaptability to work in dynamic and changing environments.
* Leadership skills to guide and mentor development teams.
* Ability to influence decision-making at various levels of the organization


Minimum qualifications:* Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Proven experience as a Solution Architect or a similar role with 3-5 years of experience.
* Strong knowledge of enterprise architecture principles and practices.
* Proficiency in designing and implementing solutions using a variety of technologies and platforms.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to balance business and technical objectives and articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Experience with Salesforce, Workday, and integration platforms
* Experience & knowledge of typical business processes, such as Lead to Opportunity, Opportunity to Order, etc.


Preferred qualifications:* TOGAF certification
* MS Azure certification


Pay Range – This role’s range is $110,500. - $196,500. The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that Curriculum Associates considers in making compensation decisions based on our Compensation Philosophy. Actual base pay within that range will vary based upon several factors including, but not limited to, prior experience and relevant skill sets. At Curriculum Associates, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances for each case. This role is also eligible to participate in the company bonus plan. The Company recognizes that minimum wage varies by location and will ensure all compensation decisions comply with applicable state and local laws.  

Benefits – Benefit eligible employees (and their families) are covered by medical, dental, vision, and basic life insurance. Employees can enroll in our company’s 401k plan and receive an employer match. Employees have access to a flexible vacation and sick policy in addition to twelve paid holidays and a winter office closure between Christmas and New Year's, as well as a number of additional perks and benefits.
Application deadline: March 30, 2024. This is subject to close earlier if there is a high volume of applicants or a qualified hire is made.
  
*Curriculum Associates, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. Curriculum Associates will not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment based on any legally-recognized basis, including, but not limited to: race (including ancestry, national origin, ethnic characteristics, interracial marriage or association, and traits historically associated with race such as hair texture and protective hairstyles), color, religion and creed (including all aspects of religious observance, practice and belief), sex (including pregnancy, lactation, childbirth or related medical conditions, breastfeeding, sex assigned at birth, difference of sex development and variations of sex characteristics), affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, citizenship or immigration status, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including testing and characteristics), veteran or uniformed servicemember status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.**If you need special assistance or an accommodation for a disability in order to apply for a posted position, please contact our People and Culture department at* *people@cainc.com**.**Curriculum Associates uses E-Verify to confirm the employment eligibility of all newly hired employees. To learn more about E-Verify, including your rights and responsibilities, please visit:* *https://www.e-verify.gov/employees/employee-rights-and-responsibilities**Information that you provide when applying for employment with Curriculum Associates, LLC may be subject to the California Privacy Rights Act.*

title: Solution Architect
description:
**Company Overview:**  

ADT has been in the business of helping save lives since 1874. As the #1 smart home security provider in the U.S., we help protect and connect families, businesses and larger commercial customer every day. Our continuous innovation, advanced technology and strategic partnerships deliver products and services that help protect life and valuables, whether at home, your business or on the go. And as times change, so do we.Above all, our mission is clear: we help save lives for a living. Looking for a career where you can make a real impact? Join our team today and put purpose behind your paycheck. #WeAreADT
*Check out more about life at ADT* here.**Summary:**



ADT is seeking an experienced software architect to lead and develop software development projects. Collaborating with other software architects and engineers, you’ll be responsible for determining, planning, and delegating tasks on all software development projects. Our ideal candidate is highly skilled in information technology and equipped with great problem-solving and leadership abilities. Fluency in multiple programming languages is a must, along with significant knowledge of subjects such as database design, content management systems, and enterprise service bus architecture.


**ADT Mission Statement:**



At ADT, safety and security are more than just words we use. They are a commitment we make each day to our 8 million customers. We handle 15 million alarms a year, and on the other end of each call is a person. Our longevity has helped us build an infrastructure that allows us to protect you in a way no other company can. Our experience has allowed us to refine our technology to keep you safe like never before. Our dedication to service lets us care for your home or business the way we care for our own families. What we provide at ADT goes beyond the products we offer. What we really provide is peace of mind. We help our customers feel the comfort and security that only comes with feeling safe. Everything we deliver is about ensuring security, from the installation of our systems to the speed with which we answer and respond to calls. We understand that the security needs of individuals, families and businesses are changing rapidly—mobile families, kids at college, parents, cyberthreats—there’s a lot to keep up with. That’s why we never stop finding new ways to keep you safe. Whether it’s your home, your business, or those you love, ADT is thinking about your security. We believe the work we do matters. We make a difference here. We protect people, we save lives, we keep you safe.


**General Responsibilities:**



Individuals may perform any combination of functions shown below and adhere to the ADT Mission Statement. This position description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, knowledge, or abilities associated with this classification, but are intended to accurately reflect the principal job elements.


**Responsibilities:**


* Design robust software architectures using established patterns and principles.
* Determine and analyze business requirements and translate to technical designs.
* Establish and manage full SDLC for multiple domains including current state, target state, and technical debt.
* Review development work products for compliance with architecture.
* Assist QA engineers in test development.
* Identify and resolve issues in software systems as needed.
* Document software architectures and requirements.
* Approve final products before launch.
* Develop and document software architectures that meet business requirements.
* Incorporate and enforce standards.
* Determine non-functional requirements and incorporate into architecture.
* Collaborate with other software architects and engineers to develop holistic, end-to-end solutions.
* Coordinate architectures across systems and technologies to ensure robust end-to-end processing.
* Proactive involvement in and ownership of Architectural Review Board topics and discussions.
* Present architectures and roadmaps to peers and leadership.


**Skills and Abilities:**


* Proven experience as an Solution Architect, with a track record of successfully delivering enterprise-wide solutions.
* Deep knowledge of multiple programming languages and frameworks.
* Database design skills.
* Knowledge in many of the following areas: Salesforce, Oracle apps, Java, GCP, AWS, CICD pipelines, Git, Mulesoft, Apigee, software development, architectural guidelines.
* Strong technical background with expertise in multiple technology domains such as application development, infrastructure, data management, security, cloud computing, etc.
* Hands-on experience in designing and implementing complex solutions using modern technologies and frameworks.
* Proficiency in tools like Lucidchart, Visio.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think strategically and translate business requirements into technology solutions.
* Strong leadership and communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and present complex ideas to technical and non-technical stakeholders.


**Education and/or Experience Requirements:**



Education: Four (4) year degree in computer science, information technology or equivalent education, work experience.



Experience: 15+ years of experience.


**Demonstrated Skills:**


* Strategic planning
* Stakeholder management
* Executive communication
* Influencing decision-making
* Mentoring application

**Environment:**



Professional office. Casual attire.


**Compensation & Benefits:**



The compensation range for this role is $132,559-$265,119 and is based on experience and qualifications.



Certain roles are eligible for annual bonus and may include equity. These awards are allocated based on company and individual performance.



We offer employees access to healthcare benefits, a 401(k) plan and company match, short-term and long-term disability coverage, life insurance, wellbeing benefits and paid time off among others. Employees accrue up to 120 hours in their first year. Your accrual rate increases after your first year. We also offer 6 paid holidays.



Anticipated application end date will be on 3/24/2024.

  

  

***ADT is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building an inclusive team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. ADT strives to ensure every employee and applicant feels valued. Visit us at jobs.adt.com/diversity to learn more.***

title: Front End Architect
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Front End Architect with a primary focus on React.js for a client project dedicated to enhancing the digital customer experience. The ideal candidate should have 5-10 years of hands-on experience in React and a strong background in Front End architecture. As a Front End Architect, you will play a pivotal role in analyzing client requirements and crafting customized digital solutions by leveraging your expertise in Solution Architecture.


**Your Responsabilities**


* Analyze client requirements and translate them into customized digital solutions using Solution Architecture.
* Develop comprehensive solution architectures and technical designs specific to digital projects.
* Foster effective collaboration across teams to ensure seamless integration of digital solutions.
* Provide expert technical guidance and support to project teams throughout the implementation lifecycle.
* Conduct rigorous system testing and troubleshooting to optimize the performance of digital solutions.
* Demonstrate advanced proficiency in React.js and Front End Analysis, as well as a strong understanding of Solution Architecture and Application Architecture Estimation.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality digital solutions that meet client expectations.


**Your Profile and Skills**


* 5-10 years of experience in React.js and Front End architecture.
* Proven expertise in Solution Architecture and Application Architecture Estimation.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively across teams.
* Fluent in English.
* Located and working from Switzerland (Work permit is mandatory); remote work from Switzerland to be determined.
* Senior level experience.


**Your Perspectives**


* Start date: asap
* Workload: 100%
* Location: 100% remote


**Contact & Info**


To apply, please submit only if you are based and working from Switzerland. Additionally, include the earliest availability/notice period, current employer, nationality, and current resident address in the CVs, preferably at the beginning of the document.

title: Sr. Solution Architect
description:
**Who We Are**
Insurity’s vision is all about empowerment. Empowering insurance organizations to quickly capitalize on new opportunities by delivering the world’s most configurable, cloud-native, easy-to-use, and intuitively analytical software. It’s also about empowering our team members through tools, training, teamwork, and professional development opportunities.

To talk the talk, we must walk the walk. We are the largest cloud-based insurance software provider for the Property & Casualty market, and we are trusted by 22 of the top 25 Property & Casualty insurance carriers and 7 of the top 10 MGAs in the U.S. today. That’s proof we walk the walk. While our product suites are some of the most compelling in the industry, it’s our team members who deliver the exceptional value and unrivaled industry expertise our customers appreciate from us.

Our team tells us over and over; working at Insurity offers you the opportunity to collaborate with and learn from some of the most creative and knowledgeable minds in insurance technology. You’ll feel welcomed even before you start your first day with us through our award-winning onboarding program.

Take the first step to joining our team by applying today and we look forward to seeing **#UatInsurity**.
**Insurity’s Next Senior Solution Architect**
The Senior Solution Architect is a trusted adviser and subject matter expert leading our client work, bringing both deep understanding of the business of insurance and the analytics that can drive success for our customers. In this role you will act as a translation layer between business and analytic modeling teams, and work with technical implementation teams to execute the approach. You will be responsible for presenting results to various levels of leadership and influence key decisions that have customer or enterprise impact. The Senior Solution Architect is an industry thought leader, understanding current industry issues and trends to leverage opportunities to bring advanced analytics solutions to our customers that will achieve their strategic goals.
**What Our Senior Solution Architect Will Do*** Partner with carriers to function as a trusted advisor, by understanding their business and developing a roadmap to leverage analytics opportunities to achieve our client’s strategic goals through a long-term engagement plan
* Develop long-term trusted relationships with executive / key client stakeholders
* Collaborate with the data science team to develop advanced predictive models and exploratory data analyses that will unveil key data insights
* Identify, drive, and lead solution-based initiatives supporting customers
* Be a key communicator of analytical results and insights to various collaborators across the company and customer base
* Support responsibility for the integration of data science, data engineering, and solution architect in support and execution of client strategic engagements

**Who We’re Looking For*** Professional experience in the property and casualty insurance industry
* Ability to work effectively with executive partners
* Customer advocacy and passion to educate and deliver value through analytics
* Expert ability to translate complex analyses and concepts to non-technical audiences within and outside of the organization
* Strong verbal communication skills across diverse set of roles including executives, managers, underwriters, actuaries, data scientists, IT, and Insurity team members
* Excellent written communication skills demonstrating the ability to create succinct, compelling audience-relevant documentation
* Key Abilities / Traits:
* Strong multi-tasking capabilities and ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
* Ability to collaborate and work autonomously
* Flexible and adaptable
* Relevant degree

**What’s In It For U*** **Flex First Workforce**: Do your work best from home or from one of our office locations; it’s your choice.
* **Generous Time Off**: Our leadership believes in taking the time you need when you need it through our Open PTO Policy.
* **Day One Health Benefits + Employer-Matched Retirement Savings**: You might think these are table stakes, but we know these matter to you.
* **More Than Just Core Values**: Our values are fundamental in how we attract, train, and retain top talent.
* **Award-Winning Onboarding Program**: We set you up from the get-go to make a significant impact from Day One and follow you through your entire first year.
* **Real Career Growth Opportunities**: We love to promote from within with over 20% of our open roles filled through internal applicants on average.

We have five Core Values at Insurity; one of which is to ***Act with Integrity***. Providing pay transparency helps you make the best decision for you. We continuously analyze and update our salary ranges for our roles according to market trends to not only ensure our employees are paid fairly, but also help close gender, race, and disability wage gaps. title: Sr. Solution Architect
description:
**Who We Are**
Insurity’s vision is all about empowerment. Empowering insurance organizations to quickly capitalize on new opportunities by delivering the world’s most configurable, cloud-native, easy-to-use, and intuitively analytical software. It’s also about empowering our team members through tools, training, teamwork, and professional development opportunities.

To talk the talk, we must walk the walk. We are the largest cloud-based insurance software provider for the Property & Casualty market, and we are trusted by 22 of the top 25 Property & Casualty insurance carriers and 7 of the top 10 MGAs in the U.S. today. That’s proof we walk the walk. While our product suites are some of the most compelling in the industry, it’s our team members who deliver the exceptional value and unrivaled industry expertise our customers appreciate from us.

Our team tells us over and over; working at Insurity offers you the opportunity to collaborate with and learn from some of the most creative and knowledgeable minds in insurance technology. You’ll feel welcomed even before you start your first day with us through our award-winning onboarding program.

Take the first step to joining our team by applying today and we look forward to seeing **#UatInsurity**.
**Insurity’s Next Senior Solution Architect**
The Senior Solution Architect is a trusted adviser and subject matter expert leading our client work, bringing both deep understanding of the business of insurance and the analytics that can drive success for our customers. In this role you will act as a translation layer between business and analytic modeling teams, and work with technical implementation teams to execute the approach. You will be responsible for presenting results to various levels of leadership and influence key decisions that have customer or enterprise impact. The Senior Solution Architect is an industry thought leader, understanding current industry issues and trends to leverage opportunities to bring advanced analytics solutions to our customers that will achieve their strategic goals.
**What Our Senior Solution Architect Will Do*** Partner with carriers to function as a trusted advisor, by understanding their business and developing a roadmap to leverage analytics opportunities to achieve our client’s strategic goals through a long-term engagement plan
* Develop long-term trusted relationships with executive / key client stakeholders
* Collaborate with the data science team to develop advanced predictive models and exploratory data analyses that will unveil key data insights
* Identify, drive, and lead solution-based initiatives supporting customers
* Be a key communicator of analytical results and insights to various collaborators across the company and customer base
* Support responsibility for the integration of data science, data engineering, and solution architect in support and execution of client strategic engagements

**Who We’re Looking For*** Professional experience in the property and casualty insurance industry
* Ability to work effectively with executive partners
* Customer advocacy and passion to educate and deliver value through analytics
* Expert ability to translate complex analyses and concepts to non-technical audiences within and outside of the organization
* Strong verbal communication skills across diverse set of roles including executives, managers, underwriters, actuaries, data scientists, IT, and Insurity team members
* Excellent written communication skills demonstrating the ability to create succinct, compelling audience-relevant documentation
* Key Abilities / Traits:
* Strong multi-tasking capabilities and ability to work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
* Ability to collaborate and work autonomously
* Flexible and adaptable
* Relevant degree

**What’s In It For U*** **Flex First Workforce**: Do your work best from home or from one of our office locations; it’s your choice.
* **Generous Time Off**: Our leadership believes in taking the time you need when you need it through our Open PTO Policy.
* **Day One Health Benefits + Employer-Matched Retirement Savings**: You might think these are table stakes, but we know these matter to you.
* **More Than Just Core Values**: Our values are fundamental in how we attract, train, and retain top talent.
* **Award-Winning Onboarding Program**: We set you up from the get-go to make a significant impact from Day One and follow you through your entire first year.
* **Real Career Growth Opportunities**: We love to promote from within with over 20% of our open roles filled through internal applicants on average.
* **Mentorship Program:** We support a champion culture and growth mindset by pairing you with experienced, talented leaders to help you grow personally and professionally.
* **Internal Networking:** Build relationships, network, collaborate, and stay connected with colleagues internally with our one-of-a kind online *Coffee for Two* program.
* **Continuous Learning Opportunities**: Own your development with your own LinkedIn Learning and Kaplan licenses.
* **Discounted University Tuition**: Employees and their families can start or continue their university career with less out-of-pocket investment through our partnerships with the University of Arizona Global Campus.
* **Employee Referral Bonus**: Once you come onboard, give Insurity the biggest compliment you can give by referring someone to work here and earn a cash bonus.



We have five Core Values at Insurity; one of which is to ***Act with Integrity***. Providing pay transparency helps you make the best decision for you. We continuously analyze and update our salary ranges for our roles according to market trends to not only ensure our employees are paid fairly, but also help close gender, race, and disability wage gaps. title: Azure Infrastructure Cloud Architect
description:
Tantus Technologies, Inc. (Tantus) - recognized by the Washington Post as a Top Workplace - is seeking a Microsoft Azure Infrastructure Cloud Architect. You will have a hands-on leadership and implementation role in architecting, configuring, implementing, and/or migrating IT systems, services, and applications from an on-premises environment to Azure cloud environments, including Azure Government Community Cloud and Azure Gov Cloud (moderate).

You will also be responsible for supporting the development and maturation of Azure Gov Cloud tenants, subscriptions, landing zones, networking, security, and infrastructure through implementation of Microsoft Azure best practices and infrastructure as code (IaC). The ideal candidate will bring a blend of subject matter expertise, effective leadership capabilities, hands-on Azure and IaC technical skills, and strong written and verbal communication skills.

\\*Must be a US Citizen and able to obtain a Public Trust. \\*

\\*\\*Remote role, but ideally prefer a DC Metro area candidate that can join the team and customer in-person 1 day per week but open to fully remote candidates. \\*\\*

**What You'll Do**

* Work with Office of the CIO (OCIO) groups to architect and design Azure environments, infrastructure, and services that enable migration of IT infrastructure, services, applications, and systems from an on-prem environment to Azure.
* Develop and implement scalable and resilient cloud architecture solutions within an Azure Gov Cloud environment.
* Develop and implement migration strategies for Microsoft Office business tools and solutions from local on premises hosted environment to Azure cloud tenants.
* Architect and administer Microsoft Entra ID.
* Create and implement a migration plan for each infrastructure service, system, and/or application that will be transitioned to Azure.
* Create architecture and data flow diagrams for hybrid cloud environments.
* Design and deploy infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools like Terraform, Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, and PowerShell.
* Ensure systems, applications, and data are high availability, backed up, and/or replicated to meet organizational requirements for disaster and business recovery.
* Analyze and ensure that proper monitoring and alerting systems are in place for systems, services, and applications.
* Evaluate and recommend Azure services based on business requirements and industry best practices.
* Collaborate with software developers, system administrators, and other stakeholders to integrate Azure solutions into existing systems and applications.
* Ensure seamless interoperability between on-premises and cloud environments.
* Implement and enforce Federal security requirements to protect Azure-based systems and data.
* Create comprehensive documentation for cloud architecture, configurations, and processes.
* Stay abreast of Azure security updates and industry trends to proactively address potential vulnerabilities.
* Monitor and optimize the performance of Azure resources, identifying and addressing bottlenecks and inefficiencies.
* Implement best practices for resource utilization, cost management, and scalability.
* Collaborate with support teams to troubleshoot and resolve incidents promptly.

**Required Knowledge and Skills**

* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
* 7+ years of experience with Microsoft Azure, primarily as an Azure solution engineer.
* 5+ years of experience with Infrastructure-Based Processes: Monitoring, Capacity Planning, Facilities Management, Performance Tuning, Asset Management, Disaster Recovery, Data Center support, Server Virtualization
* Hands-on experience with Azure services such as Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Storage, Azure Networking, Azure Active Directory, etc.
* Proven experience in migrating, designing, and implementing cloud solutions on the Microsoft Azure platform for Federal government clients.
* Strong knowledge of cloud architecture patterns, best practices, and industry standards.
* Expertise in scripting and using automation tools like PowerShell, Azure CLI, and Terraform.

**Abilities**

* Strong leadership skills and ability to collaborate effectively across a broad range of technical and non-technical personnel.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

**Nice to Haves**

* Certification in Microsoft Azure (e.g., Azure Solutions Architect Expert) is highly desirable.

**Why Tantus? We Provide:**

* Competitive total compensation package based on the work you do and the contributions you make
* An environment that supports balancing great work with a great life
* A learning organization that invests in you with $3000 annually for professional development opportunities
* Excellent healthcare programs available through United Healthcare
* Community engagement events where you will have ample opportunities to give back by volunteering
* Discretionary quarterly bonuses for above and beyond contributions and outstanding performance

**About Us**

Tantus is an IT development and management consulting firm helping federal programs become more successful, cost-effective and mission-focused through program management oversight and system development and implementation. Our people are committed to making our world better by delivering solutions to improve the effectiveness of government services and citizen experience. Tantus is Latin for “so great” or “so much” – we strive to put great things into everything we do.

Tantus is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age (40 or older), disability, military status or any other classification protected by federal, state or local law.

If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran, and require an accommodation to navigate Tantus’ careers website or apply for one of Tantus’ job openings, please contact Human Resources at Hr@tantustech.com to request a reasonable accommodation.

Know Your Rights: Workplace Discrimination is Illegal

title: IT Epic Solutions Architect-Remote
description:
**Healthcare Without Rival**
Premise Health is the world's leading direct healthcare provider and one of the largest digital providers in the country, serving over 11 million eligible lives across more than 2,500 of the largest commercial and municipal employers in the U.S. Premise partners with its clients to offer fully connected care – in-person and in the digital environment. It operates more than 800 onsite and nearsite wellness centers in 45 states and Guam, delivering care through the Digital Wellness Center and onsite, nearsite, mobile, and event solutions.

Premise delivers value by simplifying complexity and breaking down barriers to give diverse member populations access to convenient, integrated, high-quality care. We offer more than 30 products, delivering the breadth and depth of care required to serve organizations' total populations. The result is healthcare that meets the needs of members and their families, helping them live healthier while lowering costs for organizations.

Premise offers a wide range of dynamic, purpose-driven career opportunities. We are currently looking for an **IT Epic Solutions Architect** to join our team remotely.
**About the role:** The Solutions Architect is responsible for researching and creating an overall technical vision for a specific solution to a business problem. They evaluate business needs, design, describe, and manage the solution. In many ways, this person builds the bridge between a business problem and the technology solution and outlines each of the phases and requirements required to make that solution work. Once they are given a problem, solution architects are not only in charge of finding answers but also of actively leading the technical vision to success. The process requires regular feedback, adjustments, and problem-solving to meticulously design and implement potential solutions. Solution architecture itself encompasses business, system, information, security, application, and technology architecture. After solution architects have designed a solution for an existing problem, it is their job to manage the tasks and activities that are involved with its successful implementation in partnership with technical architects. Solutions architects must be prepared to work with leaders, managers, and employees across every business unit. They will work closely with Business Analysts to ensure solutions developed solve the business challenges and both will work to monitor the success of each solution. In this partnership the solutions architect will act as technology subject matter expert and will provide high quality analytic solutions that promote efficiency and enterprise-wide standardization.
**Essential Functions:*** Support the organization by gathering, organizing, formatting, and analyzing various forms of clinical and organizational data to inform research efforts and the solutions designed.
* Analyze operational workflows to determine technological gaps and enhancements
* Demonstrate analytical skills through an evaluation of multiple business cases and develop roadmaps for the business needs defined.
* Perform analytical problem outlines and propose opportunities or solutions.
* Refine user stories and prioritize the sprint backlog
* Manage interdependencies between iterations (sprints, releases, product versions, phases etc.)
* Implement/manage product versioning structures
* Communicate with key product stakeholders to determine requirements, constraints, and risks with new or enhanced product features
* Ensure key stakeholders are made aware of key information related to current or future development activity
* Define success measures for proposed solutions, develop monitoring solutions for those success measures and provide feedback to the business on the success of solutions
* Provides strong leadership in terms of how technology capabilities can support business goals and initiatives.
* May facilitate and lead brainstorming sessions, daily standups, project planning, and product deployments
* Help build and continuously improve Agile processes and ceremonies as needed
* Strong time management, organizational skills, and attention to detail.
* Demonstrate strong professional written and verbal communication skills when interacting with customers (internal and external) and on behalf of Premise Health.
* Embodies Premise Health cultural beliefs (respectful, accountable, courageous, ethical, engaged, innovative, and quality-focused)
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**Job Requirements:*** Bachelor’s degree preferred
* Experience of 5 years or more in a related field will be considered in lieu of degree.
* Requires minimum of four (4) years of experience in healthcare, product development, research, data science, reporting and analytics, or economics.
* Requires minimum three (3) years' experience working in or with a relevant EMR (Electronic Medical Record) or business application.
* Relevant industry certification preferred (examples: IIBA/TOGAF/AGILE)
* Requires demonstrable experience in independent problem solving and creative thinking with ability to effectively weigh business, industry, and organization knowledge leveraging independent communication and interaction skills
* Agile experience preferred
* SQL experience preferred, desire to learn required
* Experience collaborating across multiple cross-functional teams to define the best business solution
* Experience analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and making recommendations to support senior leadership.
* Experience establishing & maintaining relationships with individuals at various levels of the organization, such as peers, internal/external stakeholders, business partners, senior level managers.
* Experience working with virtual team members

**Preferred Experience:*** Analytical Thinking and Problem Solving – Creative Thinking, Decision Making, Learning, Problem Solving, Systems Thinking, Conceptual Thinking, and Visual Thinking
* Behavioral Characteristics – Ethical, Personally Accountable, Trustworthy, Organized, and Adaptable
* Business Knowledge – Demonstrates business acumen, industry knowledge, organization knowledge, solution knowledge, and desire to learn more in these areas.
* Communication Skills – Excellent independent verbal, non-verbal, and written communication as well as active listening ability. Role focused on ability to translate business problems and needs to technical solutions.
* Interaction Skills – Independent ability to facilitate, lead and influence, work as a team, negotiate and manage conflict, and teach.
* Tools and Technology – Must be able to effectively use office productivity tools, business analysis tools, and communication tools. This includes but is not limited to the following toolsets: MS Office Suite, ServiceNow; MS Project; Video conferencing tools (Zoom, etc.); Collaboration Tools (SharePoint, Teams, etc.)
* Agile knowledge and interest required
* Advanced Microsoft Office Suite skills, with strong focus on Excel
* Demonstrated knowledge and experience working with large data sets, including design survey instruments, data collection processes, data analysis, and drafting reports on findings of the research.
* Ability to interpret and articulate research findings.
* Must have a Growth Mindset
* Strong organizational skills with a strong attention to detail and accuracy.
* Ability to work independently to complete a project.



Work-life balance is at the foundation of how decisions are made and where Premise is headed. We can only help people get, stay, and be well if we do the same for ourselves. In addition to competitive pay, Premise offers benefits packages including medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401(k), paid holidays and vacation time, a company-sponsored wellness program, and much more our talent acquisition team will be happy to share with you.

Premise Health is an equal opportunity employer; we value inclusion, and we do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.

For individuals living in California, Colorado, Washington; as well as, for individuals living in or reporting to New York State only, Premise Health is required to include an estimate of the salary and benefits for this role. While a number of factors influence salary, our estimated California, Colorado, Washington, and New York compensation is $90,000 - $100,000. Please note, this is a general guideline and your experience qualifications, geographic location, and other factors will be taken into consideration. For more information regarding the benefits we offer, please visit our career site, jobs.premisehealth.com/benefits.

title: IT Associate Cloud Architect - Remote
description:
**Why Mayo Clinic**

  

Mayo Clinic is top-ranked in more specialties than any other care provider according to U.S. News & World Report. As we work together to put the needs of the patient first, we are also dedicated to our employees, investing in competitive compensation and comprehensive benefit plans – to take care of you and your family, now and in the future. And with continuing education and advancement opportunities at every turn, you can build a long, successful career with Mayo Clinic. You’ll thrive in an environment that supports innovation, is committed to ending racism and supporting diversity, equity and inclusion, and provides the resources you need to succeed.  

  

**Responsibilities**  


The Associate Cloud Architect supports change advocacy for cloud adoption. Contributes to discussions relative to future cloud architecture direction. Supports cloud computing efforts and strategizes and is able to communicate pros and cons objectively. Supports the executive vision for cloud and participates in aspects of cloud adoption and governance processes. Supports the development of a cloud strategy and adoption. Support the architectural vision for cloud across business and technical dimensions. Deploys cloud reference architecture. Supports aspects of cloud brokering and governance across some aspects of IT and the business. Collaborates with engineers, business stakeholders, security, legal, and finance departments regarding cloud decisions and direction. Builds strong relationships across some specific areas of the organization, specifically with functional architects in each area, to influence them towards making changes necessary for cloud. Supports the design and build of cloud initiatives on multiple fronts. Supports the processes by which IT and business staff choose cloud computing as the deployment model for different applications and use cases, including the reasons why some applications should use cloud computing and others shouldn’t. Understands the criteria for evaluating, comparing, and selecting cloud providers. Supports the procurement processes to assess vendor / provider viability and risk. Supports the determination and standardization of strategic investments to the rest of the organization. Supports best practices for cloud system design, infrastructure integrations, application development practices and application runtime principles. Contributes to a risk-mitigation-mapping matrix for dealing with and overcoming common cloud risks and pitfalls, including a cloud exit strategy for each provider or application. Supports the determination of the most appropriate financial models for each cloud service that the organization procures. Support the determination, refinement, and review of costing estimates, total cost of ownership (TCO) and funding source. Supports cloud decision models. Supports cloud governance, including guidelines, policies, and guardrails, in collaboration with Enterprise Architects and/or the ARB. Supports comprehensive enterprise management processes, tools, integrations, and procedures to run the cloud systems, including other critical IT stakeholders in the design process. Manages the cloud change control process. Supports the correlation of cloud costs to business KPIs to manage spending in respect to the organization’s return on investment (ROI). Supports cost optimization by monitoring utilization and capacity metrics. Supports spend accountability towards cloud consumers, and provides them with resources to create forecasts, monitor costs and pursue optimization opportunities.

 **Qualifications**  


Bachelor’s degree with 5 years’ experience with 1 year of demonstrated leadership experience, or Associate’s degree with 7 years’ experience with 1 year demonstrated leadership experience, or HS/GED with 9 years of experience in a large, complex organization like Mayo Clinic may be considered in lieu of the degree.Applies intermediate knowledge of a particular field of specialization to the completion of moderately complex assignments. Involved in multiple small to medium sized projects. Serves as an individual contributor and acts as a consultant to peers. Functions with a moderate degree of autonomy; requires some supervision and guidance. Works as a lead or internal consultant.  

  

Demonstrated knowledge of cloud management platforms preferred. Ability to negotiate to reach agreements on issues of strategic importance where there may be widely conflicting goals or perspectives. Ability to build collaborative working relationships with various internal and external stakeholders. Ability to influence senior level management and key stakeholders. Solid understanding of strategic and new and emerging technology trends, and the practical application of existing, new, and emerging technologies to new and evolving business and operating models. Familiarity with service design and pricing in the context of cloud-based solutioning preferred. Certification in cloud engineering is required within 12-24 months.



Preferred candidate would have:


* Demonstrated knowledge and experience with GCP and/or Azure cloud technologies and services
* GCP or Azure architect/engineer certification required within 12-24 months


Authorization to work and remain in the United States, without necessity for Mayo Clinic sponsorship now, or in the future (for example, be a U.S. Citizen, national, or permanent resident, refugee, or asylee). Also, Mayo Clinic does not participate in the F-1 STEM OPT extension program.

 **Exemption Status**  

  

Exempt  

  

**Compensation Detail**  

  

$108,305 - $157,040 / year  

  

**Benefits Eligible**  

  

Yes  

  

**Schedule**  

  

Full Time  

  

**Hours/Pay Period**  

  

80  

  

**Schedule Details**  

  

Monday – Friday This position is 100% remote within the United States. This position is 100% remote within the United States.  

  

**Weekend Schedule**  

  

Not regularly scheduled, but occasional participation in afterhours work as needed.  

  

**International Assignment**  

  

No  

  

**Site Description**  

Just as our reputation has spread beyond our Minnesota roots, so have our locations. Today, our employees are located at our three major campuses in Phoenix/Scottsdale, Arizona, Jacksonville, Florida, Rochester, Minnesota, and at Mayo Clinic Health System campuses throughout Midwestern communities, and at our international locations. Each Mayo Clinic location is a special place where our employees thrive in both their work and personal lives. Learn more about what each unique Mayo Clinic campus has to offer, and where your best fit is.  

  

**Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer**
  

As an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer Mayo Clinic is committed to creating an inclusive environment that values the diversity of its employees and does not discriminate against any employee or candidate. Women, minorities, veterans, people from the LGBTQ communities and people with disabilities are strongly encouraged to apply to join our teams. Reasonable accommodations to access job openings or to apply for a job are available.  

  

  

**Recruiter**  

  

Shelly Weir

title: Customer Engineer (Solution Architect) - Remote
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled, motivated, and customer-focused Customer Engineer to join our team. As a Customer Engineer, you will be responsible for providing technical expertise, support, and guidance to our valued customers. Your primary goal will be to ensure customer satisfaction by delivering excellent service, troubleshooting complex technical issues, and implementing effective solutions. You will also play a crucial role in driving revenue growth by providing technical expertise and support throughout the sales process. You will collaborate closely with the sales team and engage with prospective customers to understand their needs, present solutions, and demonstrate the value of our products or services. This position requires strong technical acumen, excellent communication skills, the ability to effectively articulate complex concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences, and a passion for delivering exceptional customer experiences.

  

Requirements:
  

* Bachelor's degree in a relevant technical field (e.g., Computer Science, Engineering) or equivalent practical experience.
* 5+ years of relevant work experience (Network/Security/Pre Sales Engineering) - must
* Currently located in the US Central, Mountain or Pacific time zone - must
* Strong technical background with Proven experience as Customer Engineer or in a pre-sales / technical sales role, preferably in the information security industry.
* Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse audiences.
* Demonstrated ability to build rapport and establish relationships with customers, understanding their needs and providing tailored solutions.
* Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, with the ability to think critically and develop innovative solutions.
* Ability to work independently and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Willingness to travel to customer sites and industry events as needed.

  

Responsibilities:
  

* Collaborate with the sales team to identify and qualify potential customers, and actively participate in the sales process from discovery to closing deals.
* Conduct product demonstrations and deliver compelling presentations that effectively showcase our products or services' features, benefits, and value propositions.
* Understand customer requirements and business challenges, and develop innovative solutions tailored to their specific needs.
* Provide technical expertise and guidance to customers, addressing their questions, concerns, and objections during the pre-sales phase.
* Prepare and deliver technical proposals, solution designs, and product specifications that meet customer requirements and align with industry best practices.
* Collaborate with the product development and engineering teams to provide feedback on product enhancements, identify opportunities for improvement, and stay updated on the latest product releases and updates.
* Conduct proof-of-concept (POC) activities to demonstrate the feasibility and effectiveness of our solutions, ensuring customer satisfaction and building trust.
* Stay current with industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitive landscape to effectively position our products or services against competitors.
* Attend industry events, conferences, and trade shows to represent the company and actively engage with potential customers.

title: HR Tech- Business Solutions Architect
description:
### **General Information**

Country
United States
Working Schedule
Full-Time
Work Arrangement
Virtual
Commutable Distance Required
No
Travel Required
25%
Relocation Assistance Available
No
Posted Date
20-Dec-2023
Job ID
1264
### **Description and Requirements**

**Hybrid role to any MetLife office.**  


Summary* Creating enhanced digital user experiences for brokers, groups, and members with third parties via API connectivity is the future of Group Benefits. This position will be a key member of a Group Benefits Product team focused on building and integrating API capabilities with Third Party Technology Partners. These APIs will align to industry (LDEx) and/or partner specific standards to support the real-time transmission of data. If you enjoy collaborating with internal and external technology and business partners on innovative solutions in an agile environment, then this role is for you.
The Business Solution Architect is responsible for defining and communicating a shared business process and technical vision for the Agile Release Train to ensure the solution development meets the end to end business purpose. This role supports and acts on behalf of the Product Manager /Solution Manager by understanding the business process or operational impacts across multiple Agile Release Trains You work closely daily with the IT Solution Architect, System Architect within ARTS and Shared Service, business owners, product managers and operational / solution readiness leads to elaborate the solution, validate the assumptions, evaluate implementation alternatives and align the delivery across the ARTs to the overall Solution. You partner with Third Parties, Operations and business partners to ensure the solution is ready to be used in production, including any operational readiness, onboarding, and end to end testing.  
* 
* In partnership with Product /Solution Management, you identify and respond to business opportunities, define solution capabilities, define compliance requirements and other acceptance criteria. You collaborate with the ARTS and Shared Service suppliers on the solution design to ensure it meets the overall solution objectives. The Business Solution Architect is an active participant in system and solution demos to ensure the capabilities achieve their purpose.
* The Business Solution Architect is a strategic thinker with business and operational knowledge and the ability to interpret this knowledge into solutions and capabilities. Through consultative interactions, you understand the Objectives and Key Results (OKRs) that the business is trying to accomplish and ensure the solutions and capabilities will achieve those targeted results. Leveraging relationship management and facilitation skills, you bring the right partners to the table from technology, product, business, operations, and other areas, and ensure the timelines for gathering business needs and delivery of the details are met. The Business Solution Architect gains a deep understanding of the end-to-end solution and the horizontal implications across the full experience. You proactively identify and address risks, being empowered to drive the right conversations and the right work.

  

A Business Solution Architect is:  

* Customer-focused, looking across the solution with a strategic mindset to help create a holistic solution
* An excellent communicator both verbally and in writing
* Detail oriented, gathering the appropriate level of capability definition, solution design and acceptance criteria
* Supporting the Solution Managers and IT Solution Architects, as they build out a healthy backlog
* Challenging the status quo – leading to a better experience of tomorrow

Able to build strong working relationships across business and technology to enhance collaboration  

* 

  

The Work:

* Gather and document the details of presented ideas/epics, distilling them down into meaningful and useful solutions and capabilities
* Facilitate the business solution design to ensure it meets the overall solution objectives
* Provide feedback during ad hoc and formal reviews and demos to ensure the end solution will align with intended customer experience
* Liaise with the Solution Train, ARTS and Shared Services, acting as the business advocate with technology partners
* Ensure proper documentation is gathered and provided to partner teams in preparation for commercial and operational readiness
* Provide details around business rules that need to be in place when developing and delivering capabilities including acceptance criteria
* Participate in release governance to determine the business / operational impact of the specific releases


The Interactions:

* Assist and support the Product / Solution Manager on the definition and refinement details of solutions and capabilities
* Partner with Solution Manager, Product Managers and appropriate subject matter experts to ensure solutions align with the customer and market needs
* Partner with Product Managers to provide clarity and details as the ARTS are defining features.
* Manage expectations with partners, and ensure timely delivery of all artifacts required

**Required Skills:**
Bachelor's Degree


4+ years of experience in gathering, documenting, and communicating business requirements.


4+ years’ experience with organizing project teams and work plans for multiple projects - 10 yrs.
Experience estimating and planning project timelines and milestones, and administering task schedules.
Experience using data to improve business processes.


Experience with data and reporting architecture and documentation.


Exceptional, analytical, communication, prioritization, and program management skills.


Advanced Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint


Demonstrated experience in supporting multiple scrum/Kanban teams


Previous experience engaging stakeholders, contributors and technical resources to analyze user needs and resource limitations

  


 The wage range for applicants for this position is $80,000 - $120,000. This role is also eligible for annual short-term incentive compensation. MetLife offers a comprehensive benefits program, including healthcare benefits, life insurance, retirement benefits, parental leave, legal plan services and paid time off. All incentives and benefits are subject to the applicable plan terms.  


*Equal Employment Opportunity/Disability/Veterans*

*If you need an accommodation due to a disability, please email us at accommodations@metlife.com. This information will be held in confidence and used only to determine an appropriate accommodation for the application process.* *MetLife maintains a drug-free workplace.*

title: Network Architect
description:
Hi,

Greetings from Zllius Inc!

We have an urgent opening for the role**Network Architect.** If interested, revert me back with your Updated resume, along with contact details, work authorization.

**Job Role: Network Architect**

**Location: Harrisburg area (Hybrid)**

**Duration: Long-term**

**Position: W2/1099**

**Visa: Any (Except H1B)**

**Job Ref: AUG80**

**Responsibilities and Duties**

* Design and develop network architectures for on premise datacenters, cloud (public and private)
* Prepare and deliver training, documentation and network awareness activities to the Network Engineering and Operations teams
* Develop technical solutions to help mitigate observed gaps in current connectivity solutions and hardware platforms
* Align to widely accepted networking standards and frameworks with overall business and technology strategy
* Adapt networking architecture elements to adapt to new standards as they emerge
* Identify design gaps in existing and proposed networking architectures and recommend changes or enhancements
* Possess a firm understanding of the interconnectivity within and to VMware, Amazon Web Services (AWS) and the Microsoft Azure platforms
* Be a strong technologist with pragmatic view and creative mind, and a natural collaborator with line of business architects, engineers, developers, application owners, service providers, and senior management

**Qualifications Network A**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
* In Lieu of undergraduate degree, the ratio is 1:1 meaning one year of work experience equals one year of college experience
* 7+ years of increasing responsibility architecting, positioning and delivering complex network engineering and architecture solutions. This includes but is not limited to multi-datacenter interconnectivity, WAN solutions based on carrier MPLS along with Internet-based DMVPN via all manner of Internet connection types
* Familiarity with public and private cloud connectivity technologies.
* Proven experience in design and operation of diverse enterprise networks

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Deep understanding of BGP routing within the context of carrier connectivity as well as internal systems connectivity along with redistribution techniques into and from other routing technologies like EIGRP.
* Experience with large wide area networks of 1000+ sites and migrations to Cisco SD-WAN from traditional connectivity types
* Strong hands-on technical abilities and attention to detail
* Deep understanding of Network design in various environments (LAN, WAN, Datacenter, Cloud)
* Demonstrated ability to assume independent and team-based responsibilities
* Strong teamwork, interpersonal and customer service skills a must
* Proven ability to lead and mentor others
* Strong communication skills a must; ability to read, write, and speak in a professional manner
* Excellent analytical and problem solving skills are essential
* Must possess a personal sense of urgency
* Ability to effectively multi-task and adapt to changing business priorities
* An understanding of firewall concepts (traditional and NextGen) and load balancing concepts a plus

**Physical Demands**

* Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with the ADA and other federal, state, and local standards
* Sedentary work that involves sitting or remaining stationary most of the time with occasional need to move around the office to attend meetings, etc.
* Ability to conduct repetitive tasks on a computer, utilizing a mouse, keyboard, and monitor

**Thanks & Regards:**

**Zllius Inc.**

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Work Location: Remote

title: Solution Architect
description:
OSG are seeking a talented **Solution Architect (Remote)** to join our team to help support and facilitate our growth and expansion of services.


OSG is changing the way customers interact with businesses they care about. Designing and taking to market customer first solutions that change the way consumers see information through a digital lens, making payments online and secure, and keeping clients in touch with other areas of a business is a big challenge. At OSG, we think it’s a challenge worth taking on.


Possessing a curious mindset, this critical hire will have the ability to create relationships with their clients allowing you to design solutions and provide guidance for the future product roadmap, which will ultimately influence all parts of the organization including Commercial, Marketing, Product and the overall Customer Journey.


To support OSG’s vision, the ideal candidate will have a strong sales orientation, helping sellers advance the sales process for a fast-paced firm experiencing rapid transformation.


In addition, you’re a trusted advisor to not only your sales teammates, but as an invaluable resource in understanding the dynamics across the buyer's decision team and solving the client’s pain with the right solution.


Working remotely, the individual will have the opportunity to work and engage throughout the organization, including the C-suite.


**As a Solution Architect, a typical day to day might include:**


* Supporting sales to qualify early-stage opportunities and assist sellers in making go/no-go decisions
* Understand buyer's requirements, current technical environment and needs
* Work internally and externally to scope an appropriate solution for a buyer
* Demonstrate and present the capabilities of a solution
* Partner with Product org to provide voice of the field and voice of the customer feedback to inform solutions roadmap
* Transition knowledge and relationships to client engagement team, monitor progress and re-engage as needed
* Provide support for channel partners


**This job might be a fit for you if:**


* Previous experience in Sales or as a Solution Architect/Sales Engineer
* Familiarity with complex sales and SaaS buying cycles and methodologies
* Strong demo and presentation skills, especially in a virtual environment
* Familiarity with contemporary selling methodologies (e.g. Challenger, MEDDIC)
* Motivated self-starter who can effectively work under pressure in a fast-paced firm experiencing rapid transformation

**You might also have:**


* Deep understanding of AdTech landscape including CDP, DSP and ESP
* Experience in selling AdTech into OSG's core industries
* Experience in C-level sales presentations, specifically the CFO, CMO and CXO
* Expertise with Salesforce reporting and dashboards

**Benefits:**


* 3 weeks of paid time off annually; 5 sick days
* Medical, dental, vision plans, employee assistance program, as well as life insurance and LTD plans
* Supplemental life insurance
* Voluntary accident and critical illness insurance, respectively
* Flexible Spending Account available
* 401k plan

*OSG offers equal employment opportunity and will not discriminate on the bases of race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, or other non-merit based factors.”*

**RSROSG**
